results.description:
We will discuss the novella The Death of Ivan Ilyich by Leo Tolstoy, as well as the Tolstoy story "Master and Man" (available at http://www.gutenberg.org/ebooks/986 or in print), the collection Eleven Short Stories (available in print as well as at http://dspace.bhos.edu.az/jspui/bitstream/123456789/919/1/17404209.pdf or in the Files section of our website), and the stories "The Snowstorm" and "Three Deaths" (on the web site at http://www.meetup.com/Forest-Hills-Book-Group/files/). It's about 230 pages of material altogether.

We will meet at 7 p.m. on Wednesday, Sept. 30 at Sveta's House, 9260 Queens Blvd., Rego Park. It's on the south side of the street a few blocks west of the 63rd./Rego Park stop on the M and R trains, between 62nd Ave. and the Long Island Expressway.

RSVPs will open on Sept. 9 (an email will be sent at that time) but of course you can look for these works and begin reading before then.

results.description:
This is not your typical networking event.
Climbers, Founders, and Drinks

Startup Rock Climbing hosts events in Brooklyn's best climbing gym. We get sweaty, we make friends, and we learn from incredible entrepreneurs. 

You don't have to be a good climber to come. In fact, this can be your first time doing anything athletic in a long time. We'll help you get started and you'll meet some cool people in the process.

This month we're climbing with Scot Tatelman, founder of STATE Bags.


Schedule:

7:00pm - 8:30pm - Indoor rock climbing. All levels of climbing experience welcome!
8:45pm - 9:30pm - Scot talks about the 1-to-1 business model.
9:30pm - 11:00pm - Beers!

The Talk: Scot Tatelman

STATE bags sells backpacks, but their mission goes way deeper. Like Warby Parker and Tom's Shoes, for every bag they sell, they give one away. Scot will talk about the pros & cons of running a one-for-one business, and share how they have partnered with Beyonce and Angelina Jolie to help them gain national awareness.

Make sure to buy your tickets on our Eventbrite page!

Learn more on SoccerBeyond.com or Facebook.com/SoccerBeyond.

Details - Fun, interactive, effective.

60min. This is a Coed Soccer Lesson. Please bring a ball if you have. Sneakers, running and turf shoes are fine. Bring some water or sports drink and maybe sun blocker. Please note our Waiver of Liability and 24hr Cancellation Policy below. More details follow.

Rain or Shine - If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Our sessions will be held as scheduled if weather allows. Thunder or snow and ice are among the reasons for sessions to be canceled/ moved. BUT: Don't make assumptions - you will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved. As the weather changes quickly in NYC, occasionally we may make the final decision about 90min prior to session start. If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Cancelled/ Moved Sessions - You will always get notified!

Every time we have to cancel a session, if possible, we move it to the same day and time of the following week. In this case, all players keep their spots. Please email us prior to the rescheduled event, if you can't make and wish a refund or credit. The 24 hours cancellation policy applies. You will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved.

Requesting a Refund

To request a refund 1) change your status to "not going" and 2) send us a note with the Paypal transaction number related to the payment for the respective session. Refunds are processed once a week - please be patient.


24 Hours Cancellation Policy

A full refund/ credit will be given if cancellation is received at least 24 hours prior to lesson start. Full payment is required thereafter. Our cancellation policy also applies to package holders.


Waiver of Liability and Hold Harmless Agreement

By RSVP'ing for this event you certify that you are physically fit such as you are able to participate in this program. results.description:
• 

The Bible Scholar Series is an exciting one-semester Bible study class that is taught on Wall Street in Manhattan every Wednesday until November 18th. 

Amazing Christian and Jewish believers like you will gather to receive in-depth biblical and theological training. Those who complete this course will be equipped to actively fulfill the personal life calling that God has placed on their lives. This will truly be a life-changing course! Interfaith and irreligious learners are also warmly invited to enroll in this program, and they will find the curriculum enjoyable and informative. 

COMMITMENT LEVEL:


• Every Wednesday until November 18th 

• This program will consist of a two-hour class that meets each Wednesday, with a total of 11 classes during the semester (for a total of 22 hours of class time). COST & RSVP

• This is a FREE CLASS. All are welcome to join at anytime.

AT A GLANCE: 

• BIBLE KNOWLEDGE. To obtain a thorough understanding of the whole timeline of the Bible - from beginning to end. This will greatly increase you ability to see and explain God's great plan for world history. 

• CULTURAL CONTEXT. To better understand the Jewishness and cultural context in which the Old and New Testaments were written. This will help you to see many important points that God was making that often elude those who do not understand the culture that the prophets, apostles, and other biblical figures lived in.

• FAITH-OUT-OF-THE-BOX. To develop your ability to clearly communicate the saving message of Jesus to others. You will even get equipped with several high-impact Bible verses that aid greatly in sharing the message. 

• ANSWERS. To search for answers to many of the theological and philosophical questions you may have. This will strengthen your faith and confidence in talking about your faith, and it will help you to answer questions for your friends, family members, co-workers, etc. 

• TRAINING TO TEACH. For those who may feel called teach the Bible in some capacity, whether in a formal or informal setting, this class will be a very helpful path of preparation. 

• MENTORING/DISCIPLESHIP. Believers who develop in spiritual maturity should eventually be able to mentor new believers. This is an important part of spiritual growth. This course will prepare you to effectively train new believers in the Judeo-Christian faith. 

• TRAINING IN LEADERSHIP. To ready yourself to lead or co-lead successful small group Bible studies. 

• PREPPING FOR INTERNATIONAL TRIPS. To prepare yourself for high-impact world outreach and aid trips, for sharing the faith in unreached areas, and training spiritual leaders in third world nations 

• AN ALTERNATIVE TO SEMINARY. To gain some of the important knowledge that you would gain in an accredited seminary degree in Theological and Biblical Studies - but without having to commit to a massive program.

Class taught by Beau Lee, the Director of the Brooklyn Ark. More information and course descriptions, please visit BrooklynArk.com.
results.name: BIBLE SCHOLAR SERIES: A HIGH-GROWTH BIBLE STUDY CLASS

Happy Fall! 

The next meeting of the NJ FileMaker User Group will be held on Wednesday, September 30, from 7 PM to 9 PM at the Ridgewood Board of Education. The Center's address:

49 Cottage Place
Second Floor
Ridgewood, NJ 07451

http://tinyurl.com/ayu55jy

MEETING AGENDA: soSIMPLE Calendar with Ken d'Oronzio of Paradise Partners

soSIMPLE Calendar allows you to seamlessly add an elegant drag and drop calendar interface not only to your FileMaker Pro®-based solution, but to your web site, your iCal software, and FileMaker Go. This introduction will take you soup to nuts - integrating a calendar into your own solution from scratch, customizing it, and rolling it out for multiple use cases. Don't come too late - the initial integration happens pretty quickly.

Paradise Partners revolutionized FileMaker calendars in 2011 by introducing a user-friendly, drag & drop FileMaker calendar in a web viewer with the release of soSIMPLE v1. soSIMPLE v2 opened up the idea even further by introducing interactive calendars to FileMaker WebDirect, smartphone and direct-to-web. The latest soSIMPLE v3 added standalone calendars for FileMaker Pro and FileMaker Go, making FileMaker Server optional. The newest version also added an out-of-the-box experience with a fully featured calendar solution without any integration required.

We look forward to seeing you on the 30th. Please feel free to pass this email along to anyone you think would be interested in attending our meetings.

Best,

Debi Rubel
results.name: September NJFMPUG Meeting - 9/30/15

results.description:
In conjunction with our exclusive exhibition of The Doghouse, a unique, first-person reality film experience, the Made in NY Media Center is excited to present a Q&A with creators Mads Damsbo and Johan Knattrup Jensen, moderated by StoryCode’s Mike Knowlton.

After debuting last weekend at the New York Film Festival’s Convergence 2015, The Doghouse is designed to challenge and shatter all expectations of what a short film can be and the experience one can provide.

From conception to production to exhibition, we will dive deep into The Doghouse to examine the physical and mental hurdles that have faced the project since day one, including the conception of the of the idea, production and distribution challenges, and finally, getting the installation into NYFF's Convergence.

“This is really new territory. For the body, the mind, and the art.” – Politiken About The Participants

Mads Damsbo – With a background in film and media directing and with a passion for technology and experience design, Mads has found himself involved in a wide variety of alternative projects exploring the frontier of new media storytelling. He considers himself a craftsman and creative producer, and sometimes an artist and conceptual junkie.

Johann Knattrup Jensen – Johan is schooled through the progressive alternative film school Super16 where he learned the value of a good story and how it impacts an audience. With his experience in theatre, performance and as a dramatic writer, he infiltrates the core of story development at Makropol.

About The Moderator

Mike Knowlton – A digital veteran of 20 years, Mike has always pushed the boundaries of storytelling and technology. As a Creative Technologist, he founded and led numerous technology companies as well as large multi-disciplinary teams in developing complex software applications for brands including Bath & Body Works, Epoch Films, Gucci, MoMA, New York Magazine, Philosophy, Theory, Tiffany & Co., and Victoria's Secret. At his most recent venture, Murmur, he produces social films and consults with leading brands, studios, and networks on using social films to extend existing properties. Mike's background spans design, programming, advertising, and filmmaking. He graduated with a Bachelor of Arts from Miami University.
results.name: Industry Talks: VR Filmmaking with Creators of Doghouse

results.description:
=== Special guest ===

The good people at OpenCityApps build 2nd City Zoning to provide a simple way for stakeholders to view zoning regulations in their area or citywide.  As always, they kept the code open source so that others could benefit, and possibly redeploy the app in different cities.

Recently, Chris forked the project for NYC to create gothamzoning.org.  At this hacknight, he'll explain the process of forking and modifying the app, what tools and technologies were used, and how he was able to stand up a fully-featured zoning app in just a few days of part-time coding.


====

What is a civic hacknight?

This is a weekly project night is for technologists, designers, developers, data scientists, map makers, and activists who are working on "civic technology" projects. Consider this to be a study hall or office hours to improve you and the city.

This night is for those who want to: 

 * work on projects
 * start a new project, or find one to join
 * get feedback from experts 
 * learn about tools for local empowerment, open data, and open government

Bring your laptop, power supply, ideas, projects, maps, data, and questions. Collectively, we will try to answer them.

-=-=-

Hacknight resources:

For first timers trying to get the most out of the night, you should bring your laptop, power supply, and watch the following videos -- Civic Hacking 101 & Civic Hacking 102.

 * Check out conversations on talk.beta.nyc
 * Join a real time conversation via slack.beta.nyc
 * Data tools: Data.Beta.NYC, data resources, maps, & tools 
 * Community projects in process - projects.beta.nyc

-=-=-

Projects & presentations:

We keep the “formal” part of the evening down to a minimum: announcements, meet your neighbor, etc. After, we will have a number of people present, specific projects, and have some skills share / education. 

Community Projects:


 * What are YOU working on?
 * Hop over to talk and tell us.

-=-=-

Event Partners:

The Code for America Brigade program is an international network of people committed to using their voices and hands, in collaboration with local governments, to make their cities better.

Microsoft Civic aims to collaboratively address the most pressing community challenges through the hyper-local creation, deployment, and evangelism of civic technology.

Accela provides civic engagement solutions for government. Accela’s solutions uniquely address the diverse needs of their constituents by making publicly available information more accessible. The Accela Civic Platform includes solutions for land management, asset management, licensing and case management, legislative management, right of way management, citizen relationship management, recreation and resource management, environmental health and safety.

-=-=-

Note about the venue:

You should RSVP with the name that appears on a photo ID. In order to give building security an RSVP list, RSVPs will close at 4:00 PM the day of the event. If you miss this deadline, most of the time security is nice and will let you in.

BetaNYC is committed to hosting safe and open events for all. By attending this event you are committing yourself to BetaNYC's Code of Conduct and Anti-Harassment Policy.
results.how_to_find_us: Use the front staircase; we'll be in the "coworking" space.
results.name: Civic Hacknight at Civic Hall with "Gotham Zoning" (Chris Whong)

results.description:
Have you ever heard of Dollar Shave Club? How about Casper? Does JOOR strike a bell?

If you have, then the savvy PR strategists behind all of these companies have done their job. And James Dennin, one of their own, is coming to show YOU the tricks!

Learn the ins-and-outs of Tech PR strategy for your startup without having to hire a firm for $10k per month. You'll learn how to craft a proper PR strategy, how to reach out to writers, who to establish relationships with, and how to get featured in the most important publications. In other words, get your startup noticed.

This workshop's going to be super rich with information, engaging, and interactive. Come prepared to ask questions, get involved, and getcher' learn on!

Good ol' fashioned cheese pizza, and drinks from the Harlem Brewing Co. are included in the ticket price.

Let's do this!

----
More on James Dennin:

James Dennin is a writer, content manager, and PR specialist who has worked with startups in virtually every industry from finance to fashion to mattress retail. For two years, he worked in content marketing at Kapitall, a next-generation stock trading platform launched by former E-Trade executives.

For the last year, he has worked as the Content and Media Specialist at Moxie Communications Group, where his writing has appeared on behalf of executives at Dollar Shave Club, JOOR, Casper, and many others. He has written speeches that were delivered at The Wharton School and has co-authored opinion pieces for billionaires and Congressmen. 

This summer he also worked on a number of national media campaigns, including the launch of Vroom, a used-car startup that has raised more than $100M to move the car-shopping experience online. Under his own name, James's writing has appeared in The Village Voice, Vice, BlackBook, The Street, Nasdaq, and AmericaBlog.
results.name: Workshop: Learn the ins-and-outs of Tech PR from Moxie Communications Group.

results.description:
Welcome all writers and thank you for joining!

Our agenda is as follows:

7:30-8:00 - set writing goals for upcoming week & share obstacles

8:00-8:30 - provide feedback for the chosen pieces & choose new works for following meeting

8:30-9:00 - craft discussion

9:00-9:15 - wind down & poll group

How to receive feedback:

IF you would like to be critiqued, you must attend at least one meetup to become familiar with and understand the format of the meetings. Attendees are expected to eventually submit work for feedback. In the preceding meetup we choose two writers to be critiqued. The third work is a backup if time permits. Please read them all as well as the craft essays in the "Files" section under "More" tab.

How to post:

1) Post only if you have been chosen to be critiqued and by Friday at noon. (For critique outside of meetups please post in "Pages" in the menu above.)

2) Before Posting: Long-Form Length: 3,000 words or 10 pgs max (can be shorter)

If submitting poems, max 3 a person

Double-spaced (unless for aesthetics)

11-12 point font (no smaller or larger)

Number your pages

*The organizing team maintains the right to remove pieces from circulation

3) Post in Files under More tab with this description:

- Name

- Meetup date

- Description of your work

- Type of feedback you would like

- Fiction or non-fiction specified

(As description box allows.)

When critiquing: (Always use "I" when critiquing)

1) Each person is allotted 5 mins. The writer is also allotted 5 mins to respond after everyone has spoken.

2) Share what worked and/or what you liked/ enjoyed and why.

3) Offer suggestions/ constructive criticism for improvement.

*Caffé Bene has a large assortment of coffees and teas and tasty things to eat. Please pay for your space with a purchase from the establishment.

results.description:
Wednesday Runs in Central Park!

On hump day, we own the pavement. Going forward, we'll meet on Wednesdays at 7:30PM at the southwest corner of Central Park. We'll start with a brief stretch and share, and then we'll embark on either the 3-mile or 6-mile loop.

This running group is for everyone in the innovation/startup community, but we don't discriminate. We're open to all runners and professions. Please RSVP when you know you'll be able to meet.

After our runs we'll relax at a nice nearby pub to discuss how we're going to fix the world's problems.

Clarification on the meeting spot: We'll meet at the northeast corner of Columbus Circle. This is the same as the southwest corner of Central Park. We'll meet right next to the big statue that is next to the entrance to the park trail. Just be precise, we'll meet at the immediate west of said big statue.

See you soon!

Alex
results.how_to_find_us: SW corner of Central Park on the west side of the large stature (Not the Columbus Statue in the middle of the circle) Cross streets: NE corner of Central Park West and 59th St.

results.description:
How To Succeed at Work & Home?  This relevant topic is affecting more and more dads who strive to be both equally successful as a dad and in the workplace. It's the topic we're going to tackle during our next evening workshop so hope you'll join us!

Our gracious host, Explore+Discover Early Learning Center, will provide some munchies, refreshments, and PIZZA as the dads get educated, learn some tips and best practices, get their questions answered, and listen to a lively discussion about juggling your family and career.  We'll be joined by two accomplished authors -  Scott Behson and Jim Joseph. who are also local New York dads.

We understand that dads enjoy the opportunity to attend workshops to assist them on a quest to become better parents.  After a successful sleep discussion with the "NYC Sleep Doctor" and informative 'Toddlerhood ' talk with Tovah Klein, we're excited about "Survival as a Working Dad" with Scott and Jim...the next in our series of FREE educational workshops offered to NYC Dads Group members in 2015.


Jim Joseph and Scott Behson are both good friends of NYC Dads Group and have been roving the country on their respective book tours, so it's with great pleasure that we get to chat with them together.

* This 75-90 minute discussion including Q&A is completely FREE for NYC Dads Group members

* All attendees will have the opportunity to purchase "The Working Dad's Survivial Guide" by Scott Behson and "Out and About Dad" by Jim Josph as well as get them signed after the discussion

* Light snacks, refreshments, and PIZZA will be served


* Space can accommodate 30 parents

Scott Behson, PhD, is a professor of management at Fairleigh Dickinson University, a national expert in work and family issues, a featured speaker at the recent White House Summit on Working Families, and, most importantly, a busy involved dad.

He's the author of The Working Dad’s Survival Guide: How to Succeed at Work and at Home, the first book of its kind to provide advice and encouragement for working fathers, helping them to achieve success in their careers while also being the involved, loving dads they always wanted to be. Scott founded and runs the popular blog, "Fathers, Work, and Family," dedicated to helping working fathers and encouraging more supportive workplaces. He writes regularly for the Harvard Business Review Online, Huffington Post and the Good Men Project, and has also been published in TIME and The Wall Street Journal. He frequently appears in media, including MSNBC, NPR and Fox News.   

Jim Joseph: Entrepreneur of the Year, Agency of the Year, Consumer Launch Campaign of the Year, Most Creative Agency, Best Place to Work, Social Media Icon, Hall of Fame – these are the accolades that Jim Joseph has amassed through his long career in marketing. But none are more important than the daily badge he wears with the most pride – Dad.

As the Chief Integrated Marketing Officer and President of the Americas for Cohn & Wolfe, Jim brings over twenty-five years of consumer marketing leadership, bold management prowess, and a fine head of hair to the agency. Jim’s an award-winning three-time author; a professor at New York University; and a member of the Board of Directors for the number one branding school in the country, The Brandcenter at VCU. 

His latest adventure is his most personal to date..a brand new book, Out and About Dad, chronicles his unique journey as a father during a very unique time in our cultural evolution.

Explore+Discover is dedicated to offering quality education and care for infants and toddlers in a social setting where creativity is nurtured. Our professionally trained staff, responsive curriculum and beautiful facility offer an experience of natural discovery where each child thrives and grows socially, physically and cognitively every single day. Website:  http://www.explorediscover.net/

**Disclosure Note: This is a sponsored event with Explore+Discover in which we have received compensation. We limit our sponsored collaborations to relevant partners that offer products and services we believe in. **

results.description:
Let's play Crokinole on Wednesday nights!


Don't know Crokinole? It's like a table-top version of curling, shuffleboard, darts and billiards. If you like just one of these games, you'll probably dig Crokinole.

To learn more about this traditional Canadian game (circa 1860) and about our specific weekly sessions at Milk and Roses, then read the papers!


We've been in a few rags lately, and the best-written article is this one... from the Toronto Star: http://www.thestar.com/news/insight/2015/07/26/crokinole-gains-a-following-in-brooklyn-thanks-to-canadian-expat.html

Same place as usual: Milk and Roses (1110 Manhattan Ave in Greenpoint, between Dupont and Clay).

Same time as usual: 7:30pm 'till close.

Please RSVP if you'd like to join in! If I know how many people are coming, then I can be sure to have enough boards present and polished for plenty of playing time for all :)

results.description:
Are you a woman who is seeking to live a  more conscious, aware life with more inner-peace, contentment, self-love and inner-freedom?

Have you been going through challenging transitions and growth that can feel overwhelming

Do you sometimes feel alone on this journey, and would like to connect with other like-minded women on the path, so you know you're not the only one experiencing these feelings?

At these gatherings we will hold a space that is welcoming, healing, supportive and with a sense of the sacred that feels nourishing and nurturing - where we can step out of our everyday lives and tune in to explore our deeper longings, desires, yearnings and callings, and how we can live more fulfilling and meaningful lives.  We will share, listen, grow, heal, laugh, cry and evolve together.  Bring the wise-woman within you and give her a place to open up and blossom.


THE INTENTION & OBJECTIVE OF THIS GROUP IS TO:


• Hold a sacred space for self-reflection, growth, evolution and healing, allowing us to see with new awareness and perspective and helping us to live our lives more consciously and intentionally.

• Share our challenges, triumphs and aspirations with like-minded women; reawaken to our dreams, deeper purpose and authenticity, get some clarity around what's in our way, what might be holding us back and what we might need to move us forward; and inspire and be inspired by each other to our next steps.

• Create a nurturing atmosphere of support as we explore deeper possibilities of the lessons life is seeking to teach us, in order to heal, evolve and build a strong inner foundation.

• Inspire self-love, self-care and self-respect, and a deeper and stronger  relationship with ourselves.  To realize that it is our own acceptance, recognition and love we are truly seeking ....so we learn to stop abandoning and betraying our own selves.  To really get that with our connection to Source, we truly have everything inside that we need.

• Learn how to identify and meet our own deepest needs ....so we feel cared for, nurtured, nourished and completely loved and adored.  And to learn how to, more and more, connect with and build a relationship with the inner-companion ....the sacred beloved that accompanies us in this existence, that is always within us ....and always available to us.

• Develop compassion and appreciation of self, and to learn how to speak lovingly, kindly and supportively to ourselves, instead of the negative ways we can many times speak with, and treat ourselves.

• Refresh and renew our spirit, re-connect us to our deeper nature, our inherent wholeness and the gift of our powerful & sacred feminine energy.

***FOR THIS MEETUP:  Please write down the 2 or 3 biggest challenges/ obstacles that you're dealing with right now, or the 2 or 3 biggest questions about achieving your next level of growth - - or just write what you'd like to get out of coming to the group. PLEASE BRING THIS WITH YOU. 


For more information about my work with women, and working with me privately, you can to to www.renamajeed.com .

Our typical agenda: - We orient new visitors and then chat a bit, as by sharing what's new or good in our lives. - Then we meditate together by chanting mantra followed by the beautiful sounds of the gong - And finally we share thoughts and questions, learning something new sometimes, generally supporting each other best we can.

Note that we meet every Wednesday, 7:30 to 9 pm, and every Saturday, 2 to 3:30 pm -- except for the first Saturday of the month, when we begin our meeting at 5 pm followed by an informal potluck social. If you are planning on staying for the potluck, be sure to visit www.perfectpotluck.com to enter your food selection. The website will help you decide what food to contribute to the potluck to make sure we have a healthy, balanced meal.

By the way, the meetup page may show only a few members planning to attend a particular meeting. That's because many people attend regularly and don't bother to RSVP for each meeting.   We never have only a few members at a meeting. A dozen or more usually attend each meeting. The special potluck meetings we hold the first Saturday of each month has an average attendance of two dozen people.

Call Merrill or Mataji anytime you have questions:[masked]-5334.

results.description:
REGISTER HERE, FOR FREE.


This is a free introductory livestream that will be followed in subsequent weeks by a 5-part paid series called “Being the Infinite Self.” Participants may attend via computer, tablet, or smartphone, or may dial-in via phone.

Award-winning author, channel & psychic Paul Selig, will lead a live, interactive video webinar where he will explain his work, deliver a channeled lecture and allow participants to ask questions directly to his Guides. Paul’s Guides have been delivering new, groundbreaking teachings on Mastery. Paul’s 4th channeled text, The Book of Mastery will be released in January 2016 from Tarcher/Penguin, so this is a unique opportunity to experience this new work in advance of the book’s release. Paul and his Guides will lead you on a journey of self-development, at once building awareness of your own life purpose and building your ability to improve life for others.

A video recording of each session will be made available to all registered attendees at no additional charge so that if you miss the session or simply want to review it again, you can do so at your leisure.

Register here for the free livestream. For questions about the session, please email [masked] or call[masked]

The 5-part paid series will take place on Wednesday evenings at 8 pm Eastern Time: October 7, 14, 21, 28 and November 4. Participation in a prior session or series is not a prerequisite.

For those who haven’t registered for previous sessions, you are welcome to download those videos from Paul’s website at the AV page.

ABOUT PAUL SELIG

Paul Selig had a spiritual experience in 1987 that left him clairvoyant. He studied a form of energy healing, working at Marianne Williamson’s Manhattan Center for Living and in private practice. Paul began to “hear” for his clients, and much of his work now is as a clairaudient, clairvoyant, channel, and empath. He has led channeled energy groups for many years and, in 2009, he was invited to channel at the Esalen Institute’s Superpowers symposium, where he was filmed for the documentary Authors of the Impossible. He was also featured on the documentary series The uneXplained on the A&E/BIO channel. His books include I Am the Word, The Book of Love and Creation, and The Book of Knowing and Worth. His fourth book, The Book of Mastery, will be published in January 2016 by Tarcher/Penguin.

Register here for the free livestream.
results.name: FREE Channeled Livestream with Paul Selig: "Being the Infinite Self"

group.name: Channeled Workshops with Medium Paul Selig

results.description:
From Lisa: I read this one last winter & really enjoyed it. Time travel plays a part in the story but it's really about what her life would have been life in each of the years that she travels to compared to her modern time (set in the 1980s). I still find myself thinking of and missing this character! Also it's $1.99 on Kindle right now in case any of you have one or use the app.

From the critically acclaimed author of the New York Times bestseller The Confessions of Max Tivoli comes The Impossible Lives of Greta Wells, a rapturously romantic story of a woman who finds herself transported to the “other lives” she might have lived.

After the death of her beloved twin brother and the abandonment of her long-time lover, Greta Wells undergoes electroshock therapy. Over the course of the treatment, Greta finds herself repeatedly sent to 1918, 1941, and back to the present. Whisked from the gas-lit streets and horse-drawn carriages of the West Village to a martini-fueled lunch at the Oak Room, in these other worlds, Greta finds her brother alive and well—though fearfully masking his true personality. And her former lover is now her devoted husband…but will he be unfaithful to her in this life as well? Greta Wells is fascinated by her alter egos: in 1941, she is a devoted mother; in 1918, she is a bohemian adulteress.

In this spellbinding novel by Andrew Sean Greer, each reality has its own losses, its own rewards; each extracts a different price. Which life will she choose as she wrestles with the unpredictability of love and the consequences of even her most carefully considered choices?
results.name: Sept Meetup:  Discussion of The Impossible Lives of Greta Wells (Greer)

results.description:
Come and join us for an evening of fun and TurnOn. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC?

We play 3 communication game (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can have the life that you want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early, doors close at 8:10p. COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For info contact [masked]

Can't make this one? visit us at www.turnonny.us

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8OWkv9zms4E
results.name: TurnON New York City

results.description:
This is a really unique and special experience, the kitchen table at Empellon Cocina. From the restaurant:

We built a special table at Empellón Cocina where the kitchen can interact directly with its guests. For this table we prepare a collection of our newest creations in the format of a multi course tasting menu nightly.


Empellon Cocina is run by former WD-50 pastry chef Alex Stupak. These will be our four seats! Please note the tasting menu is special and reviews for the restaurant are not for this tasting menu, which has been featured in many different publications.


There have been a few articles written about this tasting menu:

http://ny.eater.com/2015/5/20/8631243/alex-stupak-is-back-in-the-kitchen-with-a-long-tasting-menu-at

http://nycfoodie.com/blog/2015/7/15/nyc-foodie-quick-bite-the-kitchen-table-at-empellon-cocina

http://thefooddocu.blogspot.com/2015/07/the-kitchen-table-at-empellon-cocina.html

We will be doing the longer (22+ course) menu which starts at 8 PM. The cost is $165 plus tax and tip. Given that the restaurant asks for a credit card I am asking for the $165 up front. Per usual, I will return this in full when you show up for the meal (it's just to cover me in case someone doesn't show up, which I can't imagine would happen). The deposit is not refundable but you are welcome to give your spot to someone else if you become unable to make it. The dinner lasts approximately 2.5 hours.


Thanks and hope to see you there!
results.name: Empellon Cocina- Kitchen Table

results.description:
Come and join us for an evening of fun and TurnOn. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC?

We play 3 communication game (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can have the life that you want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early, doors close at 8:10p. COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For info contact [masked]

Can't make this one? visit us at www.turnonny.us

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8OWkv9zms4E
results.name: TurnON New York City

results.description:
Are You A Little Bit Country, Or A Little Bit Rock & Roll...? Or Maybe A Little Bit Pop?

Come join us for a Karaoke Night at Mr. Gs Lounge! Free Event With No Cover And Free Parking. Just walk right in and look for the group.

The Karaoke DJ will be taking requests from anyone that would like to sing a tune. Not Brave Enough To Sing Alone? Well, you can always sing with a group as multiple microphones will be available. Or you can summon the help of liquid courage, provided by the fine bartenders of the facility! Or you can just hang out and watch others try there best to emulate there favorite musician.

8pm: Meet and socialize with other group members. Drink and eat from the menu or bar.

9pm: Karaoke DJ starts taking request for anyone that would like to sing a song and will also play some dance music for people to move to.


Mr G's is located on Paterson Plank Road in the Meadowlands Area of NJ. 2 floors to check out in this place. Fancy couches, lots of tvs, full bar, and free pool tables to play.

Free Parking In The Front And Rear Of The Building.

venue.name: Introductory Citizens' Climate Lobby Conference Call

results.description:
Be part of the team!  You CAN make a difference in the world. 

Our strategy is simple, the outcome is huge. 
Empower individuals so that they experience significant growth of their own political and personal power, as well as discover and celebrate their own capacity to make a significant difference in this world. Our volunteers break down partisan and ideological barriers by reaching out to key stakeholders to build positive, effective working relationships.

Learn how you can generate the political will for a stable climate. 
View this short video: https://youtu.be/9oyguP4nLv0

What Others Are Saying

"With all the negative news on climate and Congress it's understandable to feel discouraged.  But hopelessness is not a strategy for making a difference and neither is acting alone.  Citizens' Climate Lobby is the antidote, the missing link, the Harvard of citizen activism." ---

Sam Daley-Harris Founder, RESULTS, Microcredit Summit Campaign, and the Center for Citizen Empowerment and Transformation

"Most impressive is the work of Citizens' Climate Lobby...If you want to join the fight to save the planet, to save creation for your grandchildren, there is no more effective step you could take than becoming an active member of this group." ---

Dr. James Hansen Climate scientist and former head of the NASA Goddard Institute

"The Citizens' Climate Lobby has identified the issue of pricing carbon as a vitally important lever in promoting dialog and action on climate protection. If you've been looking for that one group to join, you can stop looking now." ---

Dr. Daniel Kammen Professor - University of California, Berkeley

To learn more about Citizens' Climate Lobby visit us online at:

www.citizensclimatelobby.org

and also register for a Wednesday night (8 PM ET)

one hour introductory conference call.

VERY IMPORTANT NOTE: Don't let a very-low RSVP sign up number on the Meet-Up site discourage you from attending. The call is advertised in other places nation-wide. People who are already members attend local meetings and may not RSVP to the meetings listed on meetup.
results.name: Learn how you can generate the political will for a stable climate.

results.description:
New Swing Dance Session With Spencer @ The JCC in Manhattan

334 Amsterdam Avenue, New York, NY @76th street


East Coast Swing/Jitterbug with  Spencer Weisbond

This six week, progressive session:
Sept 30, 2015- Nov 4, 2015
Wed
8:30PM - 9:30PM

  101: Beginner   Learn cool moves to classic tunes! This progressive, basic swing dance class will teach the absolute beginner how to Jitterbug or what is now known as East Coast Swing. For young adults and above, this partner dance class will teach beginner moves in swing and the technique to execute them properly. The class will learn a routine over a six week period. No partner, experience, or TALENT required.

    

  Teacher: Spencer Weisbond please call me with questions about your level[masked]

  Register and pricing below:

  http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/personifyebusiness/Programs/ProgramDetail.aspx?pid=634125407<a href="http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/personifyebusiness/Programs/ProgramDetail.aspx?pid=625347764"></a>

Spencer has been dancing swing since 1998. He has studied Lindy hop extensively with 4 time world champion and 8 time American champion, Nathalie Gomes. Spencer had led the outreach program for Hop Swing And & Jump dance studios at local venues around NYC.
Spencer has had his own program in swing at the JCC in Manhattan for over 8 years, and also teaches privately. He has taught for Lincoln Center’s “Midsummer Night Swing” He currently organizes the New York City Swing Dance Meetup Group, which has over 3300 members, making it one of the most active swing dance clubs in the world. Spencer also co-founded the popular NYC dance  event “Swing Remix”. www.SwingRemix.com </a>

<a href="http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/personifyebusiness/Programs/ProgramDetail.aspx?pid=135408">

results.description:
Bachata Class-

This is a advanced beginner class that that builds comfortability with the basics of Bachata dancing. The class warm-up will focus on footwork, turns, body movement and proper technique. Students will learn about proper frame and connection in order to build comfort with leading and following, all while learning a fun dance pattern to use on their next romantic night out!

* The class will include a 10 minute social dance session in order to encourage dancers to practice their new material, along with building comfort and confidence in a fun and relaxed atmosphere!

Participation fee: $15 per person or $50 for 4-week session

This is a weekly class that is regularly attended, the attendance shown for this event does not reflect the full attendance of the class, space is limited - Please RSVP if you would like to join us! 

New to our studio? Try your first class for FREE!

Like us on Facebook and E-mail us your full name along with which class you would like to attend, and your first class is on us!

You can find more information about our classes and events by visiting our Web-site, Spirare Dance Studio.

You can also find us on Facebook, Spirare Dance.

results.description:
Amayah is a belly dancer who has studied the art of middle eastern styles of dance as well as more contemporary styles of the art form. Although she has been a dancer of other styles her whole life, Amayah fell in love with belly dance upon attending Rutgers University. She auditioned and was accepted into the Rutgers Belly Dance Troupe, and very next year she was elected to be the dance coach and choreographer, a position held until graduation. Amayah has trained with belly dancers of different styles from all over the world, such as Nourhan Sharif, Zoe Jakes, Luna of Cairo, and does extensive work with Jehan Kamal and her Raqstar troupe. She is currently living and dancing in NYC, is a member of Columbia Belly Dance, where she is a Master's in Clinical Psychology student. Amayah dances mainly dances Egyptian styles, and seeks to change the negative, sexual connotation that is commonly associated with belly dance.

Call[masked] to book your table

group.name: Visionary Marketing Strategists & Leaders New York Meetup

results.description:
Hey Guys,

The 7v7 Co-Ed Tournament is back this Fall, Oct 10th.

15% early bird offer ends Sept 30th!


At signup apply code: Fall15. Team & free-agent registration at: http://www.group-stage.com/1daytourny/

World Cup format. All players receive team jerseys and post tournament drink specials in the LES! The Champions win trophies! Minimum 4 games so everyone gets plenty of game time.


DETAILS:

• Teams are 7v7, max roster 10 players


•  22min matches, unlimited subs

• Players receive GSF T-shirt


•  Finalists awarded medals

•  2 female players required during matches


•  Drinks specials at a local bar

REGISTRATION:


1. FREE AGENT: $29.65* Register here.


2. TEAM: $275* Register here.

Teams are confirmed once payment is received in full. Free-Agents that want to be on the same team as friends, just let us know in the comments section. 

*15% Early Bird ends Sept 30th.

RULES:

- Groups A & B, 4 teams in each. Like the World Cup group stage, top 2 teams progress to the next round. Other Teams play 3rd v 3rd and 4th v 4th match.

- Standard Tournament scoring (3 points for a win, 1 for a draw). If teams are tied on points, standings are decided by goal difference then goals scored.


- Players must be in proper soccer attire and team color, cleats are allowed on the turf field.

- Free-Agents are placed on a team. If you would like to be on a specific team let us know in the comment section, we will try to accommodate everyone.

The Footy Fanatics!

Grand FC / Group Stage FC
results.name: 1-Day Tournament 7v7 Co-Ed: Sat Oct 10th @LES >> Early Bird ends Sept 30th*

group.name: NYC Indie Film, Photography, Actors, Writers & Art Creators

results.description:
Mt. Beacon Fire ~Tower Hike ~ SUNRISE

 


 A steady pace all the way so we make the sunrise and can get to work after ,,,, not good for a first time hiker .


4 miles 

Hiking Poles are helpful


Trail info- We will be taking the steps from the Gateway park to the Red trail. The trail is 6 or 7 switchbacks up to the old casino with a very rewarding look out point where you can see sweeping views of the Hudson river and surrounding area.


Distance: 4 miles round trip

The First 0.8 miles of this hike is hard, and very steep with 1000ft. elevation gain.
Mount Beacon is the second highest point in the Hudson Highlands. Depending on the map, it may be called Mount Beacon or Beacon Mountain. The mountain consists of two peaks. The northern peak is 1531ft and has a series of radio antennas on its summit. The higher southern peak is 1610ft and has a lookout tower on its summit.
On a clear morning we will see the NYC skyline lights from the summit as well as views of the town of Beacon and the majority of the Highlands (including Storm King, Breakneck Ridge, and little Sugarloaf).

+++

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below.

If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver.
Full waiver can be found on the ABOUT page.

Don't be late , we start on time : )
results.name: Mt. Beacon ~ Fire Tower Hike ~ SUNRISE ~

results.name: Let's meet up to exchange cards and fuel up!

results.description:
Positive Connections for Success is a more relaxed and personal networking group for business professionals looking to build relationships and grow their business through referrals.

We focus on:

• Networking: Building relationships and earning each others trust to become referral partners

• Education: Understanding your business and helping you articulate your business

• Leadership: Leaders of the round table philosophy, every member is a leader of this group


We follow a structured meeting agenda starting with networking to develop relationships, giving us time to talk and get to know each other while having a warm breakfast, followed by:

• One Minute Elevator Pitch

• Business Presentations with Q&A and feedback (we have a large screen & clicker/pointer available for powerpoint presentations)

• Brainstorming Session, Successes & Referrals to Help Each Others Businesses grow

• Lots of Fun in the Process

"We Refer Business Partners, Not Business Cards!"

This is a group with category/specialty specific members (only one member per category/speciality).
Please view our sponsors page or contact us to verify your industry, category and specialty, before attending a meeting so as to not be in conflict with a group member.

We meet every Thursday morning from 7:00 AM to 8:30 AM and welcome guests to come and experience the group and then apply to join.

Non-members/guests pay a $10 fee to attend, which includes a warm served breakfast of their choosing and we ask to please be prepared with a one minute elevator pitch presenting:

• who you are

• type of business

• who would be a good referral for you


Current positions that we are interviewing, to build relationships with and pass referrals to include:

• Auto Mechanic

results.description:
Thursday, October 1, 2015 from 9am to 1:30pm. Location: Asbury Hall, The LOFT:LGBT Community Center, 252 Bryant Avenue, White Plains, NY 10605

The Westchester Transgender Forum is an event for our local transgender and gender non-conforming (GNC) communities, allies, and health and human service providers. The goal is to provide a safe space for discussion, sharing and learning related to the needs of persons of trans* experience. Registration for this event is free. Funding provided by the NYS DOH AIDS Institute LGBT HHS Initiative.

Trans* is an umbrella term that refers to all of the identities within the gender identity spectrum. There’s a ton of diversity in the different identities there, but we often group them all together by using the word trans*. The asterisk makes special note in an effort to include all transgender, non-binary, and gender nonconforming identities, including (but not limited to) transgender, transsexual, transvestite, genderqueer, genderfluid, non-binary, genderfuck, genderless, agender, non-gendered, third gender, two-spirit, bigender, and trans man and trans woman.

Event Schedule: 9am-9:30am: Check-in and Breakfast

9:30am-10:45am: Opening Remarks and Keynote Speaker Dr. Elijah C. Nealy

10:45am-11am: Break

11am-12pm: Speaker Frederick Dombrowski Topic: Best practices for working with trans* clients in health and wellness settings.

12pm-1pm: Lunch and Panel Presentation. The lunch panel will feature members of the transgender and GNC communities sharing their experiences living, working and seeking services in our local area.

1pm-1:30pm: Closing Remarks and Next Steps

Questions about this event, contact The LOFT’s Director of Programs & Services Scott Havelka at #[masked] x12 or [masked]
results.name: Westchester Transgender Forum

results.description:
Are you feeling stuck in your job search? Frustrated that opportunities aren’t surfacing as you had hoped? Disappointed in your results?

Join Laura Powers for a discussion of job search tools, techniques, and strategies that will help you zero in on what’s working (and what isn't) in your job search and what you can do to improve your results.

Laura Powers is a career transition and job search coach with 19 years of experience helping professionals from diverse industries, levels and career stages develop the clarity, confidence and skills needed to find satisfying new work opportunities. Laura runs a boutique career coaching practice, Powers Career Coaching, LLC, that supports its clients both virtually and in-person at its offices in Westchester, Fairfield County and Manhattan. In addition to her work as a private career coach, Laura has been a corporate career transition consultant with four major outplacement firms, a career advisor with The Hartford Financial Services Group, and, in her first career, a corporate and private banking lender in the metropolitan New York area.

Seating is on a first come, first seated basis unless otherwise noted.

With meditation and visualisation, this powerful 30 minute broadcast features beautiful sounds and music to uplift, energise and inspire.

Experience the benefit of the enhanced collective energy of meditating with other people, whilst being in the comfort of your own home or office.

Each meditation includes an introduction, followed by a time in which to meditate in whatever way is easy and natural to you.

You are then guided through a visualisation enabling you to focus on living your ideal life.

If you need any technical help connecting to Meditation 101 Live please click here.

Here is an example of a typical Mastermind:

5:30pm – Open mix and mingle (15 minutes)

5:45-6:30pm – Group business needs requests/Mastermind (45 minutes)

6:30-7:00pm – Connection exchange (30 minutes – or longer, as space availability allows)

It's a 'smallish' event with between 4-12 in attendance, so we have the time and environment to get to know each other.  Plus, it's relaxed and enjoyable, so join us!

results.description:
We will be ascending the Major Welch, taking in the sunset and socializing at Perkins Tower, then descending on the AT. Bring a snack and beverage of choice to  enjoy during the break. We will be descending in the dark. Make sure you bring a working headlamp.

We will meet in the main large parking lot closest to the Inn. We will be leaving at 5:45 sharp in an attempt to make the sunset. If you are running late, you are welcome to catch up with the group. This hike is a short distance however the hike up will get your heart pumping. It is a lot of elevation in a short distance.

Make sure you have a copy of the map, a headlamp, and minimum 2 liter of water.  If you fall behind during the hike, you must be prepared to finish on your own. Faster hikers are not obligated to wait for slower hikers. Typically we meet at the parking lot and begin together. As we ascend, the group breaks off. We reconvene at the peak and begin our descent together.  You must feel comfortable hiking out on your own should you fall behind. We would love to have everyone join but due the nature of an evening event we can not make accommodations for those who are unable to hike independently. This is not mean, it is for your protection as well as the safety of the group. If you are unsure whether or not this is for you, please email me with any questions.

 Rain may cancel and would be determined that day if necessary.

Distance: about 4 miles round trip

Gain: about 1200

Hike time: approx 3 hours

This is a dog friendly hike. Park rule: on leash 6' or less. My rule: they must have current rabies and Lepto vaccines for our pups protection as well as our hikers.

HUDSON VALLEY HIKER LEGAL DISCLAIMER  & WAIVER OF LIABILITY

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below.

results.description:
Join DM Kyle Wagenblast as he recreates the classic D&D 2E module "Adam's Wrath" by Lisa Smedman. This is an adventure in the Ravenloft setting, updated to D&D 5E, and is for characters of 5th level.

In the domain of Lamordia, Doctor Victor Mordenheim created Adam, cobbling the creature together from parts of human corpses. Now, years later, Adam wants revenge. Adam wants Elise, Victor's wife. Adam wants Victor dead.

The players' ship founders on the coast of the domain of Lamordia. A vicious storm leaves them washed ashore, cold and hungry on the ice-bound Isle of Agony... then, the terror begins.
results.name: D&D 5E: Ravenloft - Adam's Wrath

results.description:
Hi Everyone,

Our October NJ Flippers and Funders Event will be this Thursday night!  This month, the focus will be exclusively on Networking.  The event will last from 6-10PM and dinner will be served between 7:00 and 7:30.  If you have any wholesale deals, please feel free to bring them for our deals table.  As always, we will share the contact info of all who attend (and choose to participate).  If you plan to attend, please RSVP on our group page, or by emailing your name and any guests to [masked].  See below for details and we hope to see you all out on Thursday!

Kyle and Mariel

NJ Flippers and Funders Event Details

Date: Thursday, October 1st

Time: 6-10PM

Schedule: 6-10PM, Open Networking, 7-7:30 Dinner

Cost: $25 at the door, Dinner Included

Information Sharing:  Guests will have the opportunity to share their information with all who attend.  We will collect contact info, specialty and what you’re looking for, and then email it out in a spreadsheet after the event.


Funding For Deals

If you are in need of funding for a deal, all Flippers and Funders Events are Sponsored by Alpha Funding Solutions.  Alpha funds 80-90% of Purchase Price and 100% of Renovation Costs.  Loan sizes range from 100K to 10 Million.  If you would like to learn more about Alpha’s program, reach out to me directly at [masked].

Professional Organizing Services

If you are in need of Professional Organizing Services, or Packing/Unpacking Services, reach out to us at [masked].

TV Show Casting

If you’re interested in auditioning for the TV Show First Time Flippers, email your contact information to [masked] and we will have them reach out to you.

Gap Funding For Deals

If you are interested in providing gap funding for other investors’ deals, we maintain a list of gap funders to refer people to.  If you are interested in gap funding as a way to make a nice return or to learn the business, email us your contact info and how much you’re looking to invest at [masked] and we will add you to the list.

Sponsorship

If you are interested in becoming a sponsor of this event, reach out to us at [masked].
results.how_to_find_us: Drive up the long driveway, park in the back, come through the main doors, and we will be in the large banquet room on the right.
results.name: 24th NJ Flippers and Funders Event

results.description:
Going to try and make this weekly until the snow comes:

Any one interested in some speed (track) workout during the week? I usually try and get to Berkeley Heights high school once a week. Dates flexible if more interested.


My plan is to do some 800m repeats at my 10k race goal pace.  Workout will look like this:

10-15 minute warmup with dynamic movement

10 min core work

6 x 800m at 10k pace.  2 min recovery between rep

10 min cool down

Note that this is a member-run meetup: no one is responsible for you but you. Your event host is not responsible for you or any injuries that could happen as you willingly run across rough terrain with roots, rocks, gullies, etc. Don't expect anyone to have first aid knowledge, supplies, or water for you. Just a bunch of like-minded people enjoying the trails together! For more details see section 6.2 of http://www.meetup.com/terms/
results.name: Berkeley Heights Track Workout- Round 2

results.description:
Raising capital is difficult, complicated, frustrating and often will lead to failure. The tools and techniques you will acquire in this workshop may put you on the path to succeed!


Some of the many factors to consider are: Who will provide the money, how to find financing sources and how to make it happen -- Choosing a path to follow can be overwhelming. Facing the risks, costs and effort involved with raising capital, may make you hesitate to take the leap.


- What type of financing is best for your business? 

- Do you need new money, why, and what forms will be most appropriate?

- How do you find a funder?.. Where do you start looking? 

- What  do you need to have to satisfy an investor?

- What are the trade-offs among various funding alternatives?

Some of the topics will include: Getting ready for funding, What investors look for in companies, Venture Capital, Angels, Startup Financing, Microloans, Bank Loans, SBA, Royalty Financing, Grants, Peer-to-Peer lending, Initial Public Offering, SBIC, Crowdfunding and, where to find them!  


Some of the techniques are: Do's and Don'ts when pitching investors, What VC’s and Angels expect to know about your business, Getting ready for funding, Overcoming common obstacles, How to convince Investors.

This workshop will discuss the process of raising money, from the early development stage of financing to finding investors.

Do NOT miss this workshop designed to give you access to an unprecedented amount of knowledge and insights shared by Roger Kuperways, Ph.D., an industry insider, life-long entrepreneur, investor, mentor, business coach and adjunct professor of entrepreneurship -- He built a multi-million dollar empire from scratch and has many years of experience in a variety of businesses and industries. He also lectures at trade shows and corporate events on Business issues. The workshop is based on lectures given by Dr. Kuperways at New York University for more than 25 years.


WORKSHOP CAPACITY IS 20 PEOPLE - THIS IS A MULTI GROUP EVENT. THE RSVP LIST ON THIS PAGE IS ONLY A PORTION OF ACTUAL ATTENDEES.

============================== 

MUST PREPAY FOR RSVP TO BE VALID!
Prepaid registration is: $75
$100 cash at the door, without a ticket (if not sold out)

Click here to purchase your ticket
http://essentials-for-raising-money-for-your-business.eventbrite.com

Remember to bring your ticket. 

Our past workshops have all sold out so don't wait! 

Please note that it is essential to have a business plan before approaching any investors. Dr. Kuperways will be leading a workshop “Essentials for Creating Your Own Business Plan” in October 2015.

============================== 

COMMENTS FROM RECENT EVENTS:

I very much enjoyed the workshop. I think you gave a very simple and clear overview of what one needs to do when venturing into a start-up. The side benefit, of course, is the input from those attending. You never know what unexpected tips you might get!  Thank you for giving your time to do this.  -- JB Manton

Loved this meetup! Definitely appreciated all of the members' different insight on each other's ideas. Very informative class. Dr. Kuperways was engaging and funny, and I even came out of this meetup with a new venture idea :) Looking forward to seeing the members in another meetup. -- Paloma Garcia

I just wanted to say thanks for throwing such a great networking shindig. -- Marc Rosenberg

Hello Roger. Thank you for a very interesting meeting.  The environment and the participants were very welcoming. Lots of good topics, insights, experiences shared. It was really great. Of course I look forward to attending the next meetup. -- Lucy Torres

I very much enjoyed the workshop and would be interested in attending the one regarding creating a business plan.

Thanks so much. -- JB Manton

I thought you handled the group well last evening. I liked your equation about when you can quit your job. I didn't do that this time, and paying the price. -- Tom Graham

Hi Professor,  It was a pleasure meeting you this evening and I really enjoyed the meetup. I'm just starting out in the NYC startup ecosystem -- Suzanne Sinatra

Thank you for your invitation to attend this evenings meeting

As usual it was very interesting and I gleaned some valuable insights as well as meeting some great people

Please let me know of any other meetings you have planned -- Fay Julia Meyer

Awesome! -- GabiLovve

Thank you for a very informative session tonight! Lots of good topics discussed and I look forward to attending this Thursday’s  meetup! -- Eddie Gomez

A knowledgeable host and curious participants and a very welcoming environment ! -- Ify E

“ This Meetup was sooooo informative. I walked away with a lot of tips, information and was able to network with other interesting participants. Looking forward to the August 12th Meetup for more of the same!! ” -- Linda Dixon

The startup meeting, I thought was great! Guidance - tips - references - take action - exercises - general layout of meeting -  jam packed full of great concepts --- Aideen Sinnott

============================== 

VOLUNTEERING: As always, with such big events, we will need extra hands. Anyone that would like to assist us with registration, please email me, or come 15 minutes earlier. 

==============================

results.description:
All Bisexual, Non-monosexual, and all other Queer-identified and Bi-friendly people are invited to come join people from the greater NYC Area in a lively topic oriented discussion at BiRequest's famously open, non-judgmental, safe space. If you can't make it to the meeting, feel free to join everyone afterward around  "eight-fifteenish" for dinner.

about us: Thanks to the dedication and hard work of many good bisexual folk, BiRequest is a bisexual social discussion group serving the New York City metropolitan area since January 1994. We provide a safe space for bisexuals and bi-friendly people to gather and discuss issues of importance to us.

We're a co-ed group for adults from 18 to 80-plus who meet twice a month every 1st and 3rd Thursday evening at NYC's LGBT Center in the West Village. The meetings are moderated and focused on a discussion topic but not limited to that week's topic.

After the discussion group session, at 8 o'clock we go to dinner at a nearby, reasonably-priced restaurant for socializing and more informal discussion. We also have occasional social events such as movie nights, parties, and much more. Join us for a meeting or event and find the community you've been looking for!

People who can't make it to the meeting are invited to join our private online group BiRequest on Yahoo or on our Facebook Page BiRequest on Facebook.
results.how_to_find_us: "check the front desk for "BiRequest" meeting room."
results.name: 1st Thursday BiRequest Meeting

group.name: NYC's Bisexual, Non-Monosexual & Queer Meetup Group

"Girl in Translation" is the modern day immigrant story bringing us from Hong Kong to Brooklyn to Chinatown, with themes ranging from poverty to love to the great cultural divide...and all that gets lost in translation! We'll meet at the 55th Street Radiance Tea House to sip tea/sake and discuss!;-)

As a reminder, please bring cash and if your plans change please change your RSVP ASAP to allow members on the wait list a chance to plan accordingly and also to be fair to our venues. Thanks!:-)

results.name: Discuss "Girl in Translation" at a Chinese Tea House!

venue.name: New York Public Library Science Industry and Business Library

results.description:
Free
Career Management for Introverts
Do you feel you shouldn't have to sell yourself? Are you uncomfortable around people who are talking about their accomplishments? Do you find yourself looking for ways to get out of conversations rather than into them? Perhaps instead you find yourself coming up with the answer while the person you are listening to goes on and on or maybe you like to take time to consider your answers. If you have had any of these experiences, you may be interested in this talk. In managing our career we have to be regularly in touch with people who we don't know well and whose good opinion we need. This puts us in the awkward position of talking to and potentially wanting favors from people we are not yet friendly with. Join career coach Win Sheffield to learn ways to move ahead in the face of shyness and reluctance to talk to strangers. Techniques covered will include:
- Recognizing how to use our strengths to impress your listener in more quiet ways
- Using story techniques to approach difficult to address successes obliquely
- Structured ways to approach and prepare for conversations
- Career management methods that minimize conversation Science, Industry, and Business Library (SIBL)
188 Madison Avenue at 34th Street
No reservations necessary
results.name: Career Management for Introverts

results.description:
LADYDRINKS & FEMFESSIONALS PRESENT "HOW TO NETWORK BETTER, AN INTERACTIVE WORKSHOP"


OCTOBER 1ST 6–9PM


LK BENNETT


655 Madison Avenue New York, NY 10065


Buy tickets here: 

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/ladydrinks-october-edition-how-to-network-better-an-interactive-workshop-tickets-18003205071

Event Synopsis:


October 1st, Lady Drinks hosts a workshop on “HOW TO NETWORK BETTER.” What messages are you transmitting with your body language when you first enter the room? Once you open your mouth, are you making content driven conversation? And hey, how do you leverage that business card once you’ve walked out of the room? This panel will aim to answer those questions. Afterwards we will role play three different networking scenarios you may have encountered with the spirited Terri Trespicio. Everyone in the audience weighs in on what they would do differently (on index cards).

PANEL

PANELIST 1: (What is your body language conveying) Robyn Hatcher, Speaketc

PANELIST 2: (relationship building and how to have content driven conversations the event) Cara Power, Cara Power coaching

PANELIST 3: (maximizing referrals once you’ve left the event) Cynthia Greenawalt, Seachange Networking

PANELIST 4: (how apparel plays a part in how you show up to network) Tania Sterl, Sterl on Style

ROLE PLAYING: (role playing different networking scenarios with audience) TERRI TRESPICIO Author of Take the Work Out of Networking, and host of the weekly show, Solopreneur,

Time frame: 6–9pm

6:-6:30pm Check in and networking

6:45pm Opening remarks and introduction of the panel

6:50- 7:20 Conversation about powerful networking

7:20–7:30 role playing and conversation with the audience about what worked and what did not

7:30–9 Networking,shopping and wrap.

About LadyDrinks 

www.lady-drinks.com

Lady Drinks NY is a women’s networking initiative held the first Thursday of each month. It features workshops, panel discussions, and networking events/dinners geared towards supporting the South Asian female entrepreneur and corporate woman. TV Anchor Joya Dass uses her 15 years as a business news anchor interviewing Fortune 500 CEOS to curate the curriculum.

LadyDrinks has its roots in Toronto, when co-founder Greta Knutzen and friends started this monthly networking group in response to the recession. It helped women in film and TV get jobs, find daycare, and network with like-minded women. In its New York City iteration, it continues the mission by hosting events at boutiques and retail locations across the metropolis.

About FemFessionals 

http://www.femfessionals.com/
results.how_to_find_us: joyarani@gmail.com

results.description:
Raising capital is difficult, complicated, frustrating and often will lead to failure. The tools and techniques you will acquire in this workshop may put you on the path to succeed!


Some of the many factors to consider are: Who will provide the money, how to find financing sources and how to make it happen -- Choosing a path to follow can be overwhelming. Facing the risks, costs and effort involved with raising capital, may make you hesitate to take the leap.


- What type of financing is best for your business? 

- Do you need new money, why, and what forms will be most appropriate?

- How do you find a funder?.. Where do you start looking? 

- What  do you need to have to satisfy an investor?

- What are the trade-offs among various funding alternatives?

Some of the topics will include: Getting ready for funding, What investors look for in companies, Venture Capital, Angels, Startup Financing, Microloans, Bank Loans, SBA, Royalty Financing, Grants, Peer-to-Peer lending, Initial Public Offering, SBIC, Crowdfunding and, where to find them!  


Some of the techniques are: Do's and Don'ts when pitching investors, What VC’s and Angels expect to know about your business, Getting ready for funding, Overcoming common obstacles, How to convince Investors.

This workshop will discuss the process of raising money, from the early development stage of financing to finding investors.

Do NOT miss this workshop designed to give you access to an unprecedented amount of knowledge and insights shared by Roger Kuperways, Ph.D., an industry insider, life-long entrepreneur, investor, mentor, business coach and adjunct professor of entrepreneurship -- He built a multi-million dollar empire from scratch and has many years of experience in a variety of businesses and industries. He also lectures at trade shows and corporate events on Business issues. The workshop is based on lectures given by Dr. Kuperways at New York University for more than 25 years.


WORKSHOP CAPACITY IS 20 PEOPLE - THIS IS A MULTI GROUP EVENT. THE RSVP LIST ON THIS PAGE IS ONLY A PORTION OF ACTUAL ATTENDEES.

============================== 

MUST PREPAY FOR RSVP TO BE VALID!
Prepaid registration is: $75
$100 cash at the door, without a ticket (if not sold out)

Click here to purchase your ticket
http://essentials-for-raising-money-for-your-business.eventbrite.com

Remember to bring your ticket. 

Our past workshops have all sold out so don't wait! 

Please note that it is essential to have a business plan before approaching any investors. Dr. Kuperways will be leading a workshop “Essentials for Creating Your Own Business Plan” in October 2015.

============================== 

COMMENTS FROM RECENT EVENTS:

I very much enjoyed the workshop. I think you gave a very simple and clear overview of what one needs to do when venturing into a start-up. The side benefit, of course, is the input from those attending. You never know what unexpected tips you might get!  Thank you for giving your time to do this.  -- JB Manton

Loved this meetup! Definitely appreciated all of the members' different insight on each other's ideas. Very informative class. Dr. Kuperways was engaging and funny, and I even came out of this meetup with a new venture idea :) Looking forward to seeing the members in another meetup. -- Paloma Garcia

I just wanted to say thanks for throwing such a great networking shindig. -- Marc Rosenberg

Hello Roger. Thank you for a very interesting meeting.  The environment and the participants were very welcoming. Lots of good topics, insights, experiences shared. It was really great. Of course I look forward to attending the next meetup. -- Lucy Torres

I very much enjoyed the workshop and would be interested in attending the one regarding creating a business plan.

Thanks so much. -- JB Manton

I thought you handled the group well last evening. I liked your equation about when you can quit your job. I didn't do that this time, and paying the price. -- Tom Graham

Hi Professor,  It was a pleasure meeting you this evening and I really enjoyed the meetup. I'm just starting out in the NYC startup ecosystem -- Suzanne Sinatra

Thank you for your invitation to attend this evenings meeting

As usual it was very interesting and I gleaned some valuable insights as well as meeting some great people

Please let me know of any other meetings you have planned -- Fay Julia Meyer

Awesome! -- GabiLovve

Thank you for a very informative session tonight! Lots of good topics discussed and I look forward to attending this Thursday’s  meetup! -- Eddie Gomez

A knowledgeable host and curious participants and a very welcoming environment ! -- Ify E

“ This Meetup was sooooo informative. I walked away with a lot of tips, information and was able to network with other interesting participants. Looking forward to the August 12th Meetup for more of the same!! ” -- Linda Dixon

The startup meeting, I thought was great! Guidance - tips - references - take action - exercises - general layout of meeting -  jam packed full of great concepts --- Aideen Sinnott

============================== 

VOLUNTEERING: As always, with such big events, we will need extra hands. Anyone that would like to assist us with registration, please email me, or come 15 minutes earlier. 

============================== 

SPAM: Please don't spam our members with your products/services or company name/website because your message will be deleted and you will be banned from this group

============================== 

EVENT SPONSOR:  New York Office Suites

We provide furnished, equipped, and staffed Manhattan office space featuring amenities and services to support your business in vibrant Midtown New York. NYC Office Suites is committed to delivering service excellence and flexible office contract terms. Our contracts carry a term length of as little as 3 months. Our flexibility allows companies to match their New York office requirements with their professional needs.

We offer many New York office space sublease configurations, including executive offices, multi-person offices, coworking, shared office space for rent, flexible workspace, team / project offices and cubicles.

==============================
