The East River Park track is east of the FDR at East 6th Street. It is a little over a mile from the closest subway stops (6 to Astor Place or L to First Ave).

Thursday workouts change from week to week and will be announced in advance.

Important Information about East River Park Track: The Whippets have been running here for three years and have experienced thefts of our belongings. We will take extra precautions to keep our bags safe, but please avoid bringing valuables -- and it would be safest to run with your wallet on you.

Please be aware that there are limited overhead lights, so it gets a little dark, and during winter months the bathrooms are locked and the water fountains are off. If you have a bike, make sure you have a lock because you'll have to keep your bike outside the track area.

If you feel uncomfortable leaving your personal belongings at the track, you can drop them off at Ace Bar (531 East 5th Street between A and B) -- ask for Justin or Charlo and tell them you run with the team.  They will store our belongings for us.  ***Please note that they will not let you in without your ID so please bring that with you to the track.   http://www.acebar.com/about.html

See you there -- and please contact a Whippet captain if you have any questions!

Rain or Shine - If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Our sessions will be held as scheduled if weather allows. Thunder or snow and ice are among the reasons for sessions to be canceled/ moved. BUT: Don't make assumptions - you will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved. As the weather changes quickly in NYC, occasionally we may make the final decision about 90min prior to session start. If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Cancelled/ Moved Sessions - You will always get notified!

Every time we have to cancel a session, if possible, we move it to the same day and time of the following week. In this case, all players keep their spots. Please email us prior to the rescheduled event, if you can't make and wish a refund or credit. The 24 hours cancellation policy applies. You will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved.

Requesting a Refund

To request a refund 1) change your status to "not going" and 2) send us a note with the Paypal transaction number related to the payment for the respective session. Refunds are processed once a week - please be patient.


24 Hours Cancellation Policy

A full refund/ credit will be given if cancellation is received at least 24 hours prior to lesson start. Full payment is required thereafter. Our cancellation policy also applies to package holders.

results.description:
Seating is limited so register here to reserve your spot and get the address: http://www.coachvaleriegreene.com/stopfighting/

-Do you want to stop fighting, melt the tension in your relationship, and feel connected again?
-Are you a self-aware person and yet you and your partner still get swept up in hurtful fights that leave both of you feeling alone and disconnected?
-Or maybe one of you gets needy and demanding and the other partner withdraws?
-Or maybe it seems that your partner doesn’t care about your needs and you’re living like roommates instead of soulmates?

I’d like to invite you to a special FREE 2-hour workshop, Thursday Oct[masked] in NYC, that you can attend with or without your partner, where you will discover the secrets to break through conflict and create phenomenal love.

In this 2-hour special FREE workshop, you will learn the strategies you need to:

-Replace Anxiety and angst with warmth, intimacy and laughter
-Stop arguments before they arise, with smooth problem-solving ninja skills
-Skyrocket your sex life, because you’ll both feel understood and connected
-Live like true soul mates–because you’re on the same team again
-Get your partner to respond if they’re pulling away from you
-Or, make it your partner’s idea to give you freedom, if they’ve been nagging or needy

Seating is limited so register here to reserve your spot and get the address: http://www.coachvaleriegreene.com/stopfighting/

WHAT YOU’LL GET IN THIS 2-HR. FREE LIVE EVENT:

-We’ll bust two really popular myths that, if you believe these, your relationship is destined to fail
-You’ll learn your “fighting style” which means, what you do that keeps you and your partner caught in a never-ending cycle of fighting or feeling distant
-You’ll learn how to speak about your feelings and needs in a way that draws your partner closer instead of pushing them away
-You’ll learn the rest of the full formula to fix your relationship or save your marriage
-Then, I’ll give you the opportunity for 1-on-1 Q&A with me, because some of you will want to go deeper and reserve a free Back To Love strategy session

Space is limited, so if this speaks to you, grab your spot now! Register here: http://www.coachvaleriegreene.com/stopfighting/

About your host, Relationship Expert and Coach Valerie Greene:

Valerie is a unique relationship mentor who helps couples stop fighting and fall in love again. A highly successful alternative to relationship therapy, Valerie helps couples create a secure emotional CONNECTION; not just problem solving or communication skills. When couples feel like teammates again, win/win solutions are easy to create. From this connected place, Valerie guides couples in creating an inspiring vision/purpose for their relationship, nurturing love and intimacy, and using relationship as a vehicle for personal and spiritual growth.

Valerie holds numerous certifications in coaching, NLP, and emotional healing modalities. She has lead workshops and retreats, creates educational videos for couples, and has a 12 week program where she guides either one or both partners to reignite their love and experience intimacy and passion again. You can get her free video training “3 Steps to Stop Fighting and Start Connecting” at http://www.coachvaleriegreene.com

Success Story: We fell back in love after 8 years!

When we first came to see Valerie, we’d been married for 8 years and everything looked ok on the outside, but inside we felt distant, angry, and didn’t even want to be in the same room with each other.

Valerie met us where we were at with non-judgment and wisdom. Her intuitive and straightforward coaching helped us to re-connect our hearts and souls, work through difficult long standing issues, and feel like a team again. It felt like the ice melted; warm and caring feelings began to flow between us when we learned how to communicate and listen to each other’s deeper feelings the way that Valerie guided us to do.

We fell back in love after 8 years and now our relationship is better than it’s ever been! We still experience challenges but now we have the tools to be loving towards each other as we work through them and we have confidence that we’ll keep growing closer as time goes on. – Martin and Jessica

Seating is limited so register here to reserve your spot and get the address: http://www.coachvaleriegreene.com/stopfighting/
results.name: From Fighting to Fulfillment [Free Workshop]

results.description:
Are insects, cultured meat and meal replacement powders the key to building a better food future? Decide for yourself at this month's Food+Tech Meetup.

We'll hear from four alternative protein pioneers who are working to catapult a healthier and more sustainable food system from farm to fork. You'll get an inside look at their companies' business models, products, challenges and lessons learned.

There will also be networking, and lots of drinks and nibbles from Taste Wine Company</a>, <a href="https://www.oxverte.com/">Ox Verte, Pure Genius Provisions and Better Beast.

SCHEDULE

7:00 - 7:45: Networking, Snacks & Drinks

7:45 - 9:00: Presentations & Q&A

9:00 - 9:30: More Networking

CONFIRMED PRESENTERS

Greg Sewitz & Gabi Lewis - Co-founders, Exo - Exo is pioneering insect protein as a sustainable and nutritious food alternative.

Gilonne d'Origny - COO, New Harvest - New Harvest is a strategic grant-making organization advancing breakthroughs in cellular agriculture, that means meat, eggs, milk, etc. made from cell cultures rather than from an animal. It is kickstarting an industry of animal products made without animals and envisions a world where we consume animal products without harming life. New Harvest funds inspiring, promising and groundbreaking research while convening and informing stakeholders.

Sebastian Garcia & Danielle Soto - Co-founders, Sani -Sani is personalized food that contains every nutrient your body specifically needs based on who you are and your health goals. With just a little water, you can have a perfect meal on the go, but with four ingredients or less you can make cookies, breads and more. 

Nicole Chaszar - Founder & CEO - Splendid Spoon - Splendid Spoon cleanses and meal replacements take the hard work out of eating well.  Formulated to provide the right balance of protein, complex carb and fat, our plant-based products keep you feeling fit, full and fabulous.


MORE ABOUT OUR HOST LMHQ

Companies and individuals come together at LMHQ to collaborate, activate and accelerate their growth. From thought leadership discussions and innovation clinics, to unique social events, performances and arts + culture experiences, LMHQ is a premiere venue for the creative community to forge meaningful connections. Become a member today at lmhq.nyc.

results.description:
Tickets are $25
http://www.thebellhouseny.com/event/921913-nerds-music-night-joel-brooklyn/

PAT ROTHFUSS

Pat Rothfuss

Patrick Rothfuss was born in Madison, Wisconsin to awesome parents who encouraged him to read and create through reading to him, gentle boosts of self-esteem, and deprivation of cable television. During his formative years, he read extensively and wrote terrible short stories and poetry to teach himself what not to do.

Patrick matriculated at the University of Wisconsin-Stevens Point, initially studying chemical engineering which led to a revelation that chemical engineering is boring. He then spent the next nine years jumping from major to major, taking semesters off, enjoying semesters at part-time, and generally rocking the college student experience before being kindly asked to graduate already. Surprisingly enough, he had enough credits to graduate with an English major, and he did so grudgingly.

Patrick then went to grad school. He’d rather not talk about it.

All this time Patrick was working on “The Book,” as he and his friends lovingly titled it. When he returned to Stevens Point he began teaching half-time while trying to sell The Book to publishers. In the process, he disguised a chapter of The Book as a short story and won the Writers of the Future competition in 2002. This put him into contact with all the right people, and after deciding to split The Book into three installments, DAW agreed to publish it. In March 2007, The Name of the Wind was published to great acclaim, winning the Quill Award and making the New York Times Bestseller list.

All this success was wonderful. Patrick eventually had to stop teaching in order to focus on writing, though he screwed that up by having an adorable baby with his adorable girlfriend. He started a charity fundraiser called Worldbuilders and published a not-for-children children’s book called The Adventures of the Princess and Mr. Whiffle in July of 2010 through Subterranean Press, which was adorable, and seriously isn’t for children.

After a great deal of work and a few cleared throats and raised eyebrows from his patient editor, Wise Man’s Fear came out in March 2011 to even more acclaim, making #1 on the New York Times Bestseller list. Life continues to rock for him, and he’s working hard on writing the final installment of the series.

JOEL HODGSON

Joel Hodgson
In sixth grade, Joel Hodgson got into Magic and Ventriloquism and then went on to create the Peabody award wining Mystery Science Theater 3000. MST3K produced nearly 200 feature length episodes in a eleven year span on Comedy Central and SciFi. Last year, Joel concluded a six years run "movie riffing" live with the original cast of MST3K in "Cinematic Titanic" in theaters across the country. Joel currently voices the character of Mayor Bill Dewey in Rebecca Sugar's beautiful and funny "Steven Universe" on the Cartoon Network. This spring Joel will appear as chief engineer Zalian Fleisher in Paul Feig's new comedy science fiction series "Other Space" on Yahoo Screen.

PAUL AND STORM

Paul and Storm

Paul and Storm (Paul Sabourin and Greg “Storm” DiCostanzo) are known internationally and across the Internet for their original comedy music (often with a “nerd-ish” bent). In addition to their own live performances, they are co-founders of the geek-oriented variety show w00tstock, along with Wil Wheaton and Adam Savage, and co-produceJoCo Cruise. The duo’s original webseries musical, “LearningTown“, debuted on YouTube’s Geek & Sundry channel in January 2013. Also in 2013, their song “Another Irish Drinking Song” was featured in the hit movie Despicable Me 2, and in July had their guitar smashed on stage by George R. R. Martin (and deserved it). Their fifth full-length CD,Ball Pit, came out in 2014, and was the central item of the duo’s wildly successful Kickstarter campaign

results.description:
You're invited to join us for this weekly opportunity to sharpen your drawing skills! This session is open to sketchers of all levels.

What makes our sessions different? 

• We start on time in a large, clean, well-lit space. 

• Sketchers can concentrate because our room is quiet while the model is posing.

• We have coffee and cookies at the long break. 

• We finish on time so you can be headed home at 9:00 p.m sharp! 

• (Latecomers can be seated at a break.)


• This is a two hour drawing session to work from a live (nude) model.  

• We start with short 2 minute poses and work up to a 20 minute pose by the end of the session. We take a 5 minute break every 20 minutes. 


• There are seats for everyone tables and several light weight easels. 


• Access to a sink is available for watercolor artist.

• Bring your own materials (no oil or acrylic paint and no sprays please.)

As always if you have any questions please feel free to email me. I look forward to seeing you there. 

Simon

How did Homo sapiens evolve from an unexceptional savannah-dwelling primate to become the dominant force on the planet, emerging as the lone survivor out of six distinct, competing hominid species? How did our talent for gossip help? And who cultivated whom, humans of wheat? Tackling evolutionary concepts from a historian’s perspective, Yuval Noah Harari describes human development through a framework of three not-necessarily-orthodox “Revolutions”: the Cognitive, the Agricultural, and the Scientific. – All formats.

results.description:
Our next Kab Nights is on a topic of freedom - what does it mean to be truly free?

In most cases, our desire for freedom is expressed in the search for a retreat, an escape from the routine and daily preoccupations. We want to break free from the burdens, the pressure, from the boss at work, the overdraft in the bank, to escape the political situation, the tension, the economic situation, others' judgment of us - in short, to take a little break from life, away from this. 

But if we stop for a minute and think about it, reflect on the situation, the question will arise: what is it really that we try so hard to break away, to disconnect from? 

Join us for a warm and stimulating evening of scrutinizing this topic through authentic wisdom of Kabbalah.

results.description:
Meditation:

To discover deep internal Peace…

To wake up by connecting with your vital Force…

To live with profound Joy and a sense of Well Being…

To experience the Sacred in yourself and those around you.

……

In these times of rapid change and growing fragmentation we feel it’s important to find internal calm and meaning in life. This group offers simple down-to-earth guided meditations designed to connect with deeper parts of oneself and one’s own experience of the sacred.

We use the book “Silo’s Message” to guide our meetings. Silo is a spiritual guide who is also well-known for developing Universalist Humanism.

Our purpose is to create an environment that will nurture and foster deep experiences and help us notice them and live them in our daily life.

Our meetings are small so that everyone can interact easily and comfortably. And they are always open – no commitment or experience is required. Complete beginners are welcome

This is not a religious organization and we welcome and respect people of all backgrounds and beliefs. We work entirely on a volunteer basis. There are no costs for the meeting.

Occasionally we have day long seminars at the Hudson Valley Park of Study and Reflection. This is a beautiful retreat center located 2 hours from New York City which is part of the world-wide network of parks inspired by Silo’s work. http://www.hudsonvalleypark.org/

For information about Silo and his life:

Biography: http://silosmessage.net/about_silo.asp?LANG=EN

Description of Silo’s life work: http://newhumanist.us/?p=1211

results.description:
The NYC Junto will meet on Thursday October 1, 2015 at the General Society Library, 20 West 44th Street. Please arrive at 7:45 to hear the featured speakers. This event is free and open to the public.

The featured speakers will be Richard Epstein and Michael Huemer. They will engage in an Oxford-style debate. The proposition for debate will be: "A government that performs its fundamental functions is preferable to a system of anarcho-capitalism in which these functions are privatized."

Speaking in favor of the proposition will be Richard Epstein. Epstein is among the most influential legal thinkers in the world. He is a professor of law at New York University, a senior fellow at the Hoover Institution, and a professor emeritus and a senior lecturer at the University of Chicago. Speaking against the proposition will be Michael Huemer. Huemer is a professor of philosophy at the University of Colorado, Boulder. He has written on philosophical skepticism, the problem of induction, ethical intuitionism, free will, deontological ethics, and other topics. His latest book, The Problem of Political Authority, published in 2012, is seen by many economics and philosophers as one of the most important intellectual breakthroughs of this age.

Founded in 1985, the NYC Junto is a monthly meeting hosted by investor Victor Niederhoffer and moderated by Barron's columnist Gene Epstein.

Related Links

facebook.com/events/[masked]
meetup.org/NYCJunto
twitter.com/VicNiederhoffer
twitter.com/NYCJunto
DailySpeculations.com
results.name: Richard Epstein and Michael Huemer will debate

Whether you're joining so as to improve your communication/ presentation skills; or to become a better leader, Speak and Lead Toastmasters is here to help! Even if you simply are looking for an activity to engage in and just want to network, you can't go wrong here.

We're a friendly, supportive group that enjoys laughing and having a good time. We do things by the book and encourage all of our members to do their best. No matter what happens, we don't give up.

Won't you join us on your journey to success? The door is open - and we'll be talking.

results.description:
Our friends at The Theater Project are hosting a special GAAMC Night and you're invited! We'll be seeing an original comedy, For Whom the Southern Belle Tolls

Southern Belle is Tony Award winner (Vanya and Sonia and Masha and Spike), and local Jersey boy, Christopher Durang's parody of Tennessee Williams' The Glass Menagerie. In it we find Amanda's overly sensitive son, Lawrence, too shy to leave home or even to get a job, he's completely devoted to his glass cocktail stirrer collection. 

You'll laugh endlessly at this re-envisioning of an American classic. 

Tickets cost just $30 per person! 

The show will be performed, just for you (and about 74 of your closest friends), on Thursday, October 1, at 8:00 pm, at the Burgdorff Cultural Center.

President Sherri is scouting the perfect place for us to gather before the show for a little nosh, and we'll publicize those plans as soon as possible. 

You can order your tickets right now by following the link to their ticket vending service, Vendini. 

PLEASE be sure to use coupon code: GAAMC and click APPLY. 

Thank you!
results.name: For Whom the Southern Belle Tolls

results.description:
Getting the sex I wanted wasn't what I had read in the self-help books (or the pick-up artist books). I went about a different path. In short I went about the path of learning about women using Orgasmic Meditation (OM).

Let me tell you, I got far, far more than I bargained for.

This journey that I thought was going to be about learning a new trick, or maybe a better strategy turned out to offer me an entirely new perspective on myself and the inner terrain of women - something that had previously been invisible. So I went on a journey of looking at the places where I was protected from fully knowing women...and then I went about detonating them. OM has been the ultimate metaphor for the type of sex I wanted and the relationships I desired. The only thing that ever kept me from being the man I wanted to be was to toss it all up and say "What the fuck do I know? Take a risk!" That’s been my approach to this practice and to the lessons it’s offered me ever since my first class.

Daring to learn what goes on beneath the surface that has you become the man you want to be. Join me for an evening of learning how you can, too.

-Eli
results.name: How I Got the Sex Life I Wanted

results.description:
The year is 1987.

Motorcycle ninjas tighten their grip on Florida’s narcotics trade, viciously annihilating anyone who dares move in on their turf. Multi-national martial arts rock band Dragon Sound have had enough, and embark on a roundhouse wreck-wave of crime-crushing justice. When not chasing beach bunnies or performing their hit song “Against the Ninja,” Mark (Tae Kwon Do master/inspirational speaker Y.K. Kim) and the boys are kicking and chopping at the drug world’s smelliest underbelly. It’ll take every ounce of their blood and courage, but Dragon Sound can’t stop until they’ve completely destroyed the dealers, the drunk bikers, the kill-crazy ninjas, the middle-aged thugs, the “stupid cocaine”...and the entire MIAMI CONNECTION!!!

Directed by 9th degree black belt philosopher/author/inspirational speaker Grandmaster Y.K. Kim, the film tells the story of fearless synth rock band Dragon Sound as they embark on a roundhouse wreck-wave of crime-crushing justice in the streets of Orlando. Now in HD from elements sourced by the America Genre Film Archive (AGFA), Miami Connection will return to cinemas November 2nd and home video/digital platforms in December 12th.

Tickets on sale now!

http://www.fathomevents.com/event/rifftrax-live-miami-connection/buy
results.name: "Miami Connection" riffed LIVE!

results.description:
As an agent you only have so much time in the day and finding quality investment opportunities for your investors can prove to be a challenge. You may have your local investors who ask you about investing in markets outside your area of expertise and you are unclear on how to uncover investment opportunities for them. This can be an opportunity lost or you lose control of your clients by passing them on to a local agent for a small referral fee.

Strongbrook Real Estate is offering a new program for licensed brokers and agents who specialize in working with real estate investors. In your personal network do you work with investors who want deals with built in equity or deals with positive cash-flow income? Are you looking for opportunities to bring to your local investors in markets outside of your area of expertise?

By becoming an Approved Agent or Broker you will be able to leverage Strongbrook’s Real Estate's Investment Organization’s size and negotiating power as a group to bring your personal network of investors better deals, in markets all around the country and earn referral and marketing fees equivalent to full cooperating commissions.

We have THE solution! Expands your reach for property inventory into the best markets in the nation, and transforms your idle client database into active real estate investors. Leverage the expertise, relationships, and infrastructure of Strongbrook’s entire professional team whose focus is:

1) Training new and existing real estate investors how to create a custom game plan for retirement by conservatively purchasing cash flowing properties in the best markets.

2) Providing investors “ready-to-buy” properties.

3) Assisting investors in managing and maintaining monthly cash flow and profit. Strongbrook does all of this for you! Your clients will receive the best service and a carefully crafted step-by-step process for real estate investing success. Are you ready to increase your real estate transactions and revenue? You Can Do It!

REGISTER HERE

{WEBINAR INSTRUCTIONS WILL BE SENT VIA EMAIL TO ALL REGISTRANTS}
results.name: Real Estate Blueprint for Brokers and Agents Webinar

results.description:
• ABSOLUTELY NO CLEATS ALLOWED! NO EXCEPTIONS!!

• Permit Disclosure: No permit but field is usually unoccupied at this time.

• BRING AN ALL WHITE SHIRT (Your teammates can see you better when you wear white under the fluorescent vests.)

• We play rain or shine!

(Leader- Chris W.)

(Co-leader- Pablo G.)

(We are looking for new Co-Leaders, are you interested? Talk to Chris W)

• PLEASE ARRIVE ON TIME - 8:00PM!! Game starts at 8:15pm sharp .

• NO BALL SMASHING! THIS IS A SPECIAL NIGHT BALL!

• Full rules explained at the game.

Code of Conduct:

Positivity - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than yelling and complaining during the game.

Safety - Want to kick someone really hard? go take jiujitsu. We like our shins.

2 = Teamwork. It takes 2 to complete every pass.

Generosity!!!! - Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers.

The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

If the game is cancelled, request a refund by filling out this form.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G raises money for charities that use soccer for social good restoring dignity where it's been lost through the game of soccer. We share the impact of this movement through multiple channels and promote generosity on the field through safe and supportive play.

PS2G - Local Game. Global Change. 

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

(Leader- Chris W.)

(Co-leader- Pablo G.)

(We are looking for new Co-Leaders, are you interested? Talk to Chris W)

results.description:
“Blessed is the nation whose God is the Lord” (Ps 33:12, KJV)

Please join the Christian Party of America’s monthly Town Hall Conference Call to discuss current political issues with like-minded Christians. The conference call is the first Thursday of each month at 8:30 PM est. (7:30 PM central). Don Watson, National Vice-Chairman and North Carolina State Chairman will lead the discussion on what can be done to address the concerns we all share for the status of our country’s civil government. Earl Grover, National Board Member and Director of the Christian Men in Leadership and Veterans of the Constitution Divisions will lead us in prayer and spiritual insight about how we as Christians can turn our country back to its Christians heritage.

The Christian Party of America’s nationwide Conference Calls are a great opportunity to connect with other Christian Party supporters as we try to make a difference in this country. So sign on with us for the conference call to discuss issues and contribute your thoughts about what we can be doing politically. Our conference calls are open to the public and are for all of us who are interested in the Christian Party of America. It is an easy-access way to share ideas and learn more about what is going on around the country with the Christian Party of America. Hope you can make it!

The conference call will last for about an hour and a half, but staying for the entire call is optional. If you get a message that the circuits are busy, just keep trying the number and it eventually works. There is no extra charge to participate other than the usual charges by your phone plan for a long distance call. You can even listen in to the conference call while at other events...just hit *6 to mute your phone and you can do two things at once!
results.name: Christian Party Town Hall Conference Call

results.description:
Sign-up link for the webinar is here: https://www.innerengineering.com/online/webinars?signinsrc=Meetup-NewYork

***REGISTRATION closes 45 minutes prior to the webcast.***  Please make sure you sign-up on our website at least 45 mins prior to the webcast to receive your live log-in link via email.


(Technical Support: <a>[masked]</a>)


The Inner Engineering online program includes guided meditations, powerful breathing techniques, and deeply engaging discourses about the nature of the mind and practical wisdom to manage life’s situations.

Inner Engineering is a combination of methods derived from the ancient science of yoga that addresses every aspect of human well-being — from your body, mind and emotions to the fundamental of life energy within. 

This 1 hour introduction to Inner Engineering explains the fundamental approach of the program in a live setting that offers you the opportunity to ask a trained Isha teacher questions about the program and practices available.

“Inner Engineering is neither a religion, nor a philosophy or dogma; It is a technology for wellbeing. One does not have to believe or disbelieve, you just have to learn to use it. Technology will produce results irrespective of who you are.” – Sadhguru
results.name: An Introduction to Inner Engineering--FREE Class (Online Webinar)

results.description:
Thursday, October 1st, 9:00 PM, EST


To hear the broadcast, log on to: http://tobtr.com/7957879

To call in with questions dial:  (347)[masked]

It’s true! You can control time and space. This is a big secret that has not been available to humankind until now. You must understand that time and space are not fixed points, but rather dynamic and ever changing. Because everything works from a vibration frequency, tuning into and aligning with the right frequency can allow you to manipulate and change your experience of time itself.

In fact, time is contextual and has a different perspective depending on our thoughts at a particular moment. As our thoughts change, so do time and space. This can happen gradually or instantaneously. What we don’t realize is that these changes are going on all the time. We fail to notice them because we are caught within the vibrational wave.

However, when we stand outside of it as observers, then we can witness how everything is not only subject to change, but can be changed at will. Our idea of history and the future are not fixed points but already exist together as one. We can change our past or re-experience it if we choose. We may also travel through our future to gain insight into how things in our lives will unfold.

These secrets and the techniques for using them will all be revealed in the broadcast for the very first time ever! The frightening part of this is that the rulers of the planet are using these magical secrets to reshape the destiny of the planet. They have changed our history and are forcing us toward a dark future. But it’s not too late. If we come to the realization that we can use this power too, then we can rewrite for ourselves a new beginning and new end.

You’ve been told from your earliest years that the world is objective and unchanging. Yet our world is experiencing radical transformation, which seems to be due to cultural, political, religious, and ideological conflicts. However, Master Qesankh Maa Kheperu will reveal that these are not sociological changes, but rather shifts in time and space affecting us without our direct knowledge. Join him for this mind-blowing and extraordinary show!

Thursday, October 1, 9:00 PM, EST

To hear the broadcast, log on to: http://tobtr.com/7957879

To call in with questions dial:  (347)[masked]

results.description:
Running is a good workout. Running up a hill is an awesome workout. Be awesome!


Every week is an adventure in hill work. Every week is different. Some workouts include... 

30 minute continuous run. Sprint up the 0.4 mile incline, touch the graffiti wall at the top, turn around and jog back to the bottom and then repeat.

http://vimeo.com/81450322

Timed interval sprints. 45 seconds as hard as you can up. 1 minute and 45 seconds recovery jog back to the start. You will be winded!

http://vimeo.com/81966561

Obstacle course training. Workout stations with short sprints between them. Sprint to the first, do a bunch of situps. Sprint to the next, do some lunges. Sprint a bit further and do some squats. Sprint to the top and do some pushups. Jog back to the start and repeat.

NOTE: there is NO secure place to store bags, valuables, etc. Please use caution and do not bring anything you cannot afford to lose. If you do leave your belongings at the bottom of the bridge (where we start running) be aware that there is a lot of foot traffic and it would not be surprising if something "walked away."
results.how_to_find_us: Meet at the bottom of the Manhattan side of the Williamsburg Bridge.
results.name: Hill Running Workout

results.description:
Academy for Private Practice ["APP"] Overview and CLE Credits:

100 Lawyers Strong is partnering with Above the Law and Marino Legal to present APP, a full-day conference offering practical solutions and expert insight on meeting the challenges of starting and optimizing a small law firm practice. For the conference's full description and agenda visit abovethelaw.com/app-2015/#agenda. General Registration ends Sep 27, 2015. Tickets are $249.00.*

*100 LAWYERS STRONG EXCLUSIVE DISCOUNTS:

-FREE for Full Attorney Members (contact [masked] for your discount code); -15% for Web Attorney Members (visit www.100lawyers.com to register for the Network for free or use code "100lawyers" if you are already a Member).

You MUST purchase a ticket if you want to attend this event. See below for more information on the conference and CLE.

SAVE THE DATE

On October 2nd, 2015, Above the Law will host its inaugural Academy for Private Practice, a full-day conference offering practical solutions and expert insight on meeting the challenges of starting and optimizing a small law firm practice. The APP conference is designed for current small law practitioners looking to innovate and grow, as well as Biglaw attorneys aspiring to strike out on their own. Entrepreneurial law students aiming to bring value to potential employers are also welcome. The conference programming combines panel discussions and breakout sessions on subjects ranging from cybersecurity to marketing, all for CLE credit. Lunch will be served and the day will conclude with a networking cocktail reception.

Why attend?

-Expert insight and practical solutions for small firm practice

-Networking with peers over lunch and at our cocktail reception

-Free CLE credit

Who should attend?

-Biglaw attorneys aspiring to strike out on their own

-Small law practitioners looking to innovate and grow

-Entrepreneurial law students aiming to bring value to potential employers

CLE

Above the Law is partnering with the Marino Legal Academy, an accredited Continuing Legal Education provider, to certify the Academy for Private Practice Conference for Continuing Legal Education credits. Online Registration for CLE is required. For questions about CLE and your state’s specific Continuing Legal Education rules and requirements, please call Marino Legal Academy at[masked]-7466.

results.name: 100 LAWYERS STRONG: ATL's Small Law Firm Conference, CLE and Networking Event

results.description:
Join us if you'd like to be featured!

Featuring:

Greg Mazurek is a Director of Software Engineering at Capital One in NYC where he is building a brand new software engineering office. He was hired to create a software engineering practice that can help change retail banking for good. The team is currently working on customer facing features with the super-lofty-probably-impossible-but-we’re-still-going-to-try goal of overhauling all of the legacy systems and processes.

Previously, Greg led and worked on customer facing and mobile teams at Gilt.com for 4 years. Prior to that, he worked for a variety of start-ups in both NYC and SF. He has given presentations about user experiences and code at NY Frontenders Meetup, Refinery29, XO Group, NY CSS Meetup, Responsive Web Design NY Meetup, WalkaboutNYC, Gilt, and Uncubed. He also blogs frequently on </a><a href="https://medium.com/@gregorymazurek">https://medium.com/@gregorymazurek and tweets rarely at @gregorymazurek.

Greg wrote a children’s novel called Benjamin Buckingham And The Nightmare’s Nightmare on Github.com featured by Quartz: http://qz.com/335942/an-author-used-a-tool-for-programmers-to-write-a-book/

Village Tech Breakfast:

We'll do a round of introductions, followed by another round of questions for our featured guest. It's fun fast and interactive. Then we'll stay and chat as long as people like.

Recommended:

For more dining options with designers, developers and entrepreneurs, check out:

http://www.meetup.com/Downtown-Tech-Breakfast/

http://www.meetup.com/UWS-Startup-Meetup/

http://www.meetup.com/Midtown-Tech-Breakfast/

</a>

Come one come all Bargain hunters!! This is the mecca of savings for everything you are looking for. The Visiting Nurse Association has this as their biggest fundraiser of the year and it's well worth your attendance. No entry fee. 3 days long! Oct 2nd, 3rd & 4th!!!

This is the same event as the one we posted in May. They have 2 per year and this is the fall sale. Michael posts his phone in the "how do you find us line" also check your email the day before I will send out my # as a back up in case you can't reach Michael.

Come alone or come with kids it's up to you. Check out the website below to get more info:

www.visitingnurse.org/news-and-events/rummage

Details:

There is a tent that serves food, hamburgers, coffee, etc.. I recommend arriving early to shop. To re-iterate what Iz said:: This is a great flea market\yard sale! I have attended it several times and bought lots of good stuff. Get there early, however, as there are many tents in which to shop and LOTS of folks also looking for bargains. There are 20 tents with categories, a select few take credit cards, ALL take cash. There are sizes for everyone, and yes there's a tent just for MENSWEAR! - Michael i know you're happy. :)

Here's the scoop on the 3 days:

Day 1 - it's first look at everything that's been acquired & sorted over the last month by volunteers. People typically start to line up at a tent of their choice as early as 830.

Day 2 - regular day of shopping

Day 3- HALF PRICE DAY! - so every tent all items are half price, and most tents also have a "buy the bag" option. Each tent has their own pricing, so as an example the office supplies tent does a $5.00 buy the bag, where bon ton has 3 different sizes to chose from $25, $55, $75.

Feel free to stop by when your schedule allows. I will be there Friday and Sunday.

You can take a train from Penn Station, NYC, to the Far Hills station stop in NJ on the Gladstone line. I think it's $14.25 each way, but it might be cheaper if you buy a round trip tik. Also, I think they have discounts for seniors, students, and disabled. Here is a link for more info:

www.NJTransit.com

results.description:
Hello, Friends!

This week, We'll get a chance to hear from Tom Harari, Co-Founder and CEO of Cleanly.

Cleanly, the YC-backed on-demand company focus' on handling your laundry and dry-cleaning as soon as you need it done. They raised $2.3 million in seed funding  from earlier this year and are expanding from Manhattan to Brooklyn.

Exclusively in New York, for now, their app that allows users to order laundry pick-up and drop-off as quickly as thirty minutes from the time of ordering. You can schedule in advance as well. 

Listen in on Tom's founder journey, ask your burning questions about on-demand startups, and shout-out your projects if you're looking for help. 

Bagels and good company are complimentary!

See you Friday.
results.name: Founder's Friday with Tom Harari (Cleanly)

results.description:
Other than strict RSVP rules (if you say you're coming and you don't show, you're out of the group), this is a chill game, open to anyone who <a>signs up</a>.

Here's what separates this group from many others:

• Chill, positive attitudes. (People without forgiving personalities don't last long in this group, let alone in a given game.)

• Good quality equipment: $145 match balls; solid small goals - not pop-ups!

• Freshly laundered, adult-size, pillowy soft pinnies.

• We won't ever over-crowd a game. The size of pitch we use is best suited for 7v7. We're happy to make the pitch smaller if numbers are low. But we won't make it bigger or allow more than 7 players per team. 


• The small fee we ask of each player (at least $3 per session) supports a non-profit that we created and run: a high school soccer league for under-funded schools that don't have sufficient resources for after-school programming. 

See nyisl.com or the below video for more info. about our <a>program</a> for under-served public school students.


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WzbNWu-N-ig

We use your game-fee to help pay for our high school players' new soccer boots, socks, shin guards and much more (e.g., the league website, goals, and other equipment). 

We're particularly fond of in-kind donations: soccer boots, socks, shins, shorts, etc. 

If you have any of these, please bring them to your game and we'll be more than happy to waive your game fee!

09:30 to 09:50 Networking

results.description:
The Long Island Fair

                               October 2, 2015-October 4, 2015

We invite you to visit one of the oldest fairs in the United States. Come see the championship exhibits of agriculture, horticulture and crafts, enjoy our games, contests, entertainment and food. See Teddy Roosevelt and his Rough Riders, jugglers, lumberjacks, mounted drills, puppet shows, singers and dancers, a hot air balloon, craft demonstrations and the entire Old Bethpage Village open for your viewing. Watch teams compete to see who can win the scarecrow building contest. Try to win the prize for the fastest two man (or women) cross-cut sawing completion. There will be races and corn husking contests for the young. You will have a chance to become a farmer for a day. Come to see the animals on display and ride a wagon, pony or camel.

                                                       Ticket Prices:


                                                      Adults-$12


                                             Children Under 5 Free

results.description:
Classes are created for those with physical disabilities, aliments, recovering from surgery, Seniors OR who are seeking a gentle practice to restore the body and mind.
Classes will include poses and methods that will allow students to increase muscular strength, endurance, flexibility as well as stamina, lung capacity and overall wellness. While experiencing the positive effects Yoga has on the mind-body connection. We will practice our asana's (postures) with the use of a chair. Students can either remain seated through the session or stand and use the back of the chair while standing. Asana's are expressed both ways,so the student can find the expression that works best for their needs.

Postures are modified into variations designed to fit each individuals needs.
Classes will be held in an atmosphere that is extraordinary, surrounded by beautiful stain glass windows inside the actual church. That will complement the tranquility and peace of our practice.These classes have no bearing on religious beliefs and are open to all.
Please join me at The All Saints Episcopal Church 2329 Victory Blvd. Staten Island, N.Y. 10314.

Mondays and Fridays 11:00 am. 

Class fee is $12, or $10 for seniors.

Renate

Join this special free LIVE online event from across the world.

With meditation and visualisation, this powerful 30 minute broadcast features beautiful sounds and music to uplift, energise and inspire.

Experience the benefit of the enhanced collective energy of meditating with other people, whilst being in the comfort of your own home or office.

Each meditation includes an introduction, followed by a time in which to meditate in whatever way is easy and natural to you.

You are then guided through a visualisation enabling you to focus on living your ideal life.

 

Participating Live:

The broadcast begins promptly at 2.00pm and finishes at 2.30pm.

***Please click to join Meditation 101 Live at the scheduled broadcast time ***

Please note that the meditation and visualisation are pre-recorded to ensure sound quality however participation with other people from across the world is live.

Meditation 101 Live works best with the following internet browsers: Internet Explorer, Chrome, Safari and Opera.

If you need any technical help connecting to Meditation 101 Live please click here.

Testimonials:

"That was absolutely amazing! I don't think I have ever fully let go and quieted my mind like that before. I feel so inspired. By the end of the session I was filled with so much love - love for myself, for others, and love coming from Source. Unconditional, pure love. Thank you." C.L.

"Instead of the 'knowledge gained', I find it appropriate to give a 5 star to 'raising my vibrations' during the meditation.... the energy of the group was Amazing and ZINGING! Thanks... " - S

I had a real moment of knowing who I was, am and always be. Also, I have in the past trained in yoga and meditation but not practiced for a number of years - I felt all the beauty of it flowing connecting through my source once again aaaahhh bliss." - A.S.

results.description:
I am pleased to announce a special demonstration for our next meetup on Friday, Oct. 2nd "Technology in Theory Classroom." We will have two presentation/demonstrations and there will be plenty of opportunity for everyone to discuss and try things during the meeting. Please see below for more details, and please feel free to bring your colleagues. They do not need to be members of the group to participate.

============================================================


NYC Music Theory & Ear Training Pedagogy Meetup

Technology in the Theory Classroom

Friday, October 2nd, 2015 from 3pm–5pm

Pedagogical Advantages for Using the iPad in the Theory Classroom

Nathan Fleshner, Stephen F. Austin State University

There has been a recent explosion of music apps created for iOS devices such as the iPad. Indeed, a search of “music theory” on the App Store remarkably reveals hundreds of results. This session, the result of a comprehensive corpus study, involves an interactive demonstration of pedagogical music theory and aural skills apps for the iPad. Such apps fall into several categories including: general apps for teaching, apps for theory fundamentals, apps for aural skills, and music games and puzzles. The session will include an exploration of each app’s best features, ideas for their use, and a discussion of pros and cons for their use in different educational levels and purposes.

Creative Interfaces for Exploring Musical and Theoretical Concepts

S. Alex Ruthmann & Ethan Hein, NYU Steinhardt

The aQWERTYon and Groove Pizza are two interactive web interfaces in development within the NYU Music Experience Design Lab (MusEDLab), which researches and co-designs new technologies and experiences for music together with youth, educator, non-profit, and industry partners. The aQWERTYon maps the computer typing keyboard onto musical scales and pitch sets that can be synchronized to musical examples and videos on YouTube. The Groove Pizza is a radial rhythm interface that starts with drum beats and patterns from well-known songs as a starting point. Users can then adjust the “toppings” to create variations on the rhythms, exploring various patterns and relationships. We’ll share our interfaces in progress, some examples of how teachers are using these beta tools, and give participants the opportunity to play and give feedback on how these tools might be of use in the teaching of music theory and aural skills.

===============================================================
Nathan Fleshner is Assistant Professor and Coordinator of Music Theory at Stephen F. Austin State University. Before coming to SFA, Dr. Fleshner taught at Ithaca College and the Eastman School of Music, where he earned his PhD. He has presented papers at regional, national, and international conferences including the Society for Music Theory, the International Association for Analytical Psychology in Zurich, Switzerland, the Eighth European Music Analysis Conference in Leuven, Belgium, and the Second International Conference on Music and Consciousness in Oxford, England. He is particularly interested in the portrayal of dreams and mental illness in music. His other research interests include Schenkerian theory, the application of psychoanalysis to the study of music, connections between analysis and performance in cello music, popular music, and the pedagogical use of iPad apps. His research has been published in the Journal of Music Theory Pedagogy, the College Music Symposium, and the edited volume, Music Video Games: Maestros, Musicians, and Multiplayers.

S. Alex Ruthmann is Associate Professor of Music Education and Music Technology at NYU Steinhardt where he teaches courses at the intersection of music, education, technology, design and entrepreneurship. He leads the NYU Music Experience Design Lab, which connects students and faculty with community and industry partners in researching and designing new technologies and experiences for music making, learning and engagement. At New York University Ruthmann co-developed the Play With Your Music MOOC in collaboration with the MIT Media Lab and P2PU. He works collaboratively with student and faculty researchers in the NYU Music and Audio Research Lab on applying user and experience design methods to music technology applications. Active in social media, you can follow his curated posts on music learning, teaching and technology as @alexruthmann on Twitter.

Ethan Hein is a graduate of the NYU Music Technology masters program and a native New Yorker. He has accepted positions as adjunct faculty in music technology at NYU and Montclair State University, and also teaches electronic music production and composition for the NYU IMPACT program. His primary project with MusEDLab has been producing video and written curriculum materials for Play With Your Music. He is also working on scale and chord ontologies for web based keyboard and strum interfaces. His own preferred composition method is to get a bunch of people into the studio together with zero rehearsal, have them improvise over breakbeats, and see what comes of it.http://ethanhein.com/

results.description:
This fall, join IDP for Mindfulness-Based Stress Reduction (MBSR), the eight-week course developed by Jon Kabat-Zinn and the University of Massachusetts Medical School’s Center for Mindfulness.

Mindfulness is paying attention, on purpose, in the present moment, without judgment. MBSR uses mindful movement, meditation, group discussion, and inquiry to teach students how to use mindfulness to relate differently to stress. The course teaches practical ways to integrate mindfulness into daily life and build and sustain a personal mindfulness practice.

Studies indicate that mindfulness-based stress reduction programs can reduce anxiety and increase general well-being and overall happiness.

Mindfulness can be successfully learned and practiced by people of all backgrounds. No prior experience is necessary.

We are offering this course at a discounted rate due to its week-day time slot.  Details at this link:  http://theidproject.org/events/2015/10/02/mindfulness-based-stress-reduction-fridays-fall
results.name: Mindfulness-Based Stress Reduction - Paid Event

results.description:
The charismatic Gregori (Vincent Cassel) saunters into a hospital maternity ward and charms new mother Susanna. Eleven years later, she and her son Alexander live in Gregori’s closed community, sheltering vulnerable women and their brood in a haven isolated from the outside world. Alexander is Gregori’s prize pupil, eldest son, and star employee in the cottage industry—in which the kids are trained to run dangerous errands to provide for the group—but Gregori feels threatened by the boy’s inquisitive nature, struck by the fear that his child might not love him anymore. Meanwhile, Alexander begins to think for himself.

In his feature debut, Ariel Kleiman (a 2011 Sundance Film Festival Grand Jury Prize winner for his short film Deeper Than Yesterday) crisply constructs a fascinating hidden world, then casts innocuous moments, such as a karaoke party or a child playing with a paintball gun, in increasingly sinister light. This juxtaposition cleverly deepens and undermines our understanding of this seemingly idyllic makeshift family.

First three RSVP's receive a pair of tickets to this run, thanks to Amplify Releasing, long time supporters of my meetups!  


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mS5nblYINZk&authuser=0

results.description:
Hi there,

We find ourselves challenged to maintain an environment that would encourage our kids to learn the German language and culture. Like many in the area, we live far from family that could provide more frequent interactions in German. Since our partners are English speaking, we'd like to create opportunities for our kids to experience German not only through interacting with us parents but also with others. Hence, we would love to build supporting networks with other parents and their babies & children that would like to interact and have fun(!) in German on a regular basis.


Since the summer is winding down we have to find a good place for the fall and those cold winter days : ) Any suggestions for good places for us to play or things to do are very welcome.

See you soon!

Maria & Renate

results.description:
Join us this month in Jersey City for knitting, crocheting, good pastries and great coffee. Soft instruction for beginner knitters will be offered by me (Janna). So, if you're a newbie I will be happy to introduce you to the basics or make you more comfortable with what you already know.  Be sure to let me know you want instruction, since many people come just hang out and knit.  Feel free to come with any other craft you're working on too.

For those of you who would like knitting instruction you have some supplies options:  you can bring your own yarn and knitting needles, buy a beginner kit from me for $15 or borrow supplies for the night.  Be sure to notify me if you plan on buying a kit.

Smith and Chang closes at 8:00pm.

This Meetup is free.
results.name: Knitting Group at Smith & Chang in JC, with free beginner knitting instruction

results.description:
Bringing law and order to the good people of the world at the end of a longsword, one bad guy's face at a time. Be wary of bugbears.

Please introduce yourself before requesting to attend; note the address is not listed. Players new to D&D should inquire at Stories of Pavalon with Paul.
results.name: The Company of Phandalin

results.description:
Our monthly group meet-up is a great way to meet up the group, socialize, catch-up, pitch, get support for your projects and just to have fun.

Agenda:

Informal Networking: Getting to know each-other. Specially useful for the new-comers.

Round-table: Members share who they are, what they do, what are they planning or intending to do and what kind of help or collaboration they need.

Review & Plan: Reviewing the progress done in the last month and the plan for the coming month.

Open Forum: Any ideas, suggestions, feedback etc.

Social: Going somewhere in the neighborhood to eat, drink and more chit-chat.

Parking: There is ample parking at the back of the property or at the side road.

Some of the projects:

Feature length film "Kites Day". Script is ready and the project requires funding.

Members are welcomed to bring any friends, food and drinks in the meeting.

Contact #:[masked] for any other information or help in directions etc.
results.how_to_find_us: A corner place at Amboy Ave & Hoover Ave, block away from route 1 & Tano Mall, at the border of Metuchen and historical Clara Barton section of Edison.
results.name: Monthly Meet-up: First Friday

results.description:
This is a circle that will meet once a month with the sole purpose of connecting with and developing a personal relationship with the Angels. We will focus on two Archangels a month.

This is not about "what each Angel means" but about what is their connection with you. We will explore and see their correlations to their ancient meanings and stories, but I am far more concerned with how you personally connect with them.

Time 6:00-6:50

• September: Michael, Gabriel

• October: Raphael, Uriel

• November:  Haniel, Sandalaphon

• December: Metatron, Sariel

• January: Chamuel, Jophiel

• February: Raguel, Ariel

• March: Raziel, Zadkiel

• April: Azrael, Jeremiel

• May: Circle of all Archangels to bring balance

• June: Work with the Archangel that you are most in need of.
results.name: Circle of Angels - Monthly circle

group.name: The Indigo Papillon- A Center For Wisdom and Enlightenment

results.description:
Friends,

Join us for a fun evening this coming Friday, October 2. We will first meet for a night of mingling, drinking and more @ Suite 36.

Later that night we will go to Monarch rooftop. There we will continue the party till 4am. Both venues are less than 5 minutes away. Doors for Monarch opens @ 10pm.  We normally leave the first venue @10:15pm.


Free entry for our group members at both venues. (mention Rory's List to the door person)

Many of our Meetup groups have been invited to this event. Get to meet a fun and diverse group of people.

Feel free to come solo or with your friends.

Contact us if you have further questions.

We look forward in seeing you for a fun weekend.

Cheers,

Meetup Organizer

Rory

results.description:
Friends,

Join us this weekend for our Social Fridays @ Hudson Terrace. This venue just got better. Ladies will receive a complimentary drink @ our VIP table.( not the bar) Get there early while the drinks last!

The list for free entry will be open to our group from 6pm. Later that night we will all head to Slate NYC.

results.description:
Hi everyone, 

Are you ready for our October meetup? 

We finally found a location for our October meetup: Holland House on 5th Ave at 30th St.

Beers

Since it is the month of Oktoberfest, we picked a location famous for their beer selection: About 150 beers are available: 35 on draft, and over 100 bottle beers.

If you are the adventurous type, they have a whole selection of beer cocktails as well.

Happy Hour

$5 for select draft beers until 07:00PM

For our group only, they will extend the Happy Hour until 08:00PM.

Please see me at the event before you go to the bar.

Usually about 10 beers are included in the Happy Hour.

Food

Yes, they also have a food menu. We will have some high tables reserved for us, so you will have a place to put down your plate if you decide to order food.

Cover Charge?

None! our monthly meetup is free of charge as always.

If you like to help offset the cost for maintaining our group, you can make a $1 donation to our piggy bank, it is well appreciated but there is absolutely no obligation to do so.

How do I get there by train?

N/R - 28th St: 3 blocks

6 - 28th St: 4 blocks

B/D/F/M/Q - 34th St Herald Sq: 4 blocks

1 - 28th St: 4 blocks (a bit further than the others)

Please look at your RSVP and change it if your plans have changed so we can keep the venue updated on our expected attendance.

Have a great rest of the week everyone, see you Friday!!
results.how_to_find_us: We will probably be in the far right corner, please ask for the NYC German Culture Meetup upon entering.
results.name: Oktober German Culture Meetup - Beers at Holland House

results.description:
Annie Leibovitz: Pilgrimage charts a new direction for one of America’s best-known living photographers. Unlike her staged and carefully lit portraits made on assignment for magazines and advertising clients, the photographs in this exhibition were taken simply because Leibovitz was moved by the subject. The images speak in a commonplace language to the photographer’s curiosity about the world she inherited, spanning landscapes both dramatic and quiet, interiors of living rooms and bedrooms, and objects that are talismans of past lives.

The exhibition, which includes 70 photographs taken between April 2009 and May 2011, is organized for the Smithsonian American Art Museum by guest curator Andy Grundberg, former New York Times photography critic and associate provost and dean of undergraduate studies at the Corcoran College of Art + Design. Joann Moser, deputy chief curator, is the coordinating curator at the museum. The prints were made by David Adamson of Adamson Editions in Washington, D.C. The Bernie Stadiem Endowment Fund provided support for the exhibition. The C.F. Foundation in Atlanta supports the museum’s traveling exhibition program, Treasures to Go.


Admission is pay-as-you-wish from 6-8 pm on Fridays
results.name: Photography Exhibition

results.description:
For beginners and experienced meditators.

Metta, or Lovingkindness Meditation (LKM), is the practice of wishing oneself and others happiness, health, and ease. Based on traditional Buddhist teachings, it has become an increasingly popular practice, as it generates both concentration and a deep understanding of the nature of our connection to ourselves and others.

This is a drop-in event, and pre-registration is not necessary. We're offering it on a donation basis, and request each participant to contribute between $10 - $20 to support this and other initiatives led by The Interdependence Project. 

Please visit http://theidproject.org/events/2015/06/05/metta-meditation-group for details. 

Please note that our space is not wheelchair accessible and can only be reached by climbing two steep flights of stairs!
results.name: Lovingkindness Meditation (LKM) Group - Every Friday!

results.name: Pause Your Life: Discussion and Silent Reflection

results.description:
We are honored to host Prof. Michael Macy.  Prof. Macy is the Goldwin Smith Professor of Arts and Sciences and Director of the Social Dynamics Laboratory at Cornell, with a dual appointment in the Departments of Sociology and Information Science.  


Prof. Macy's work explores familiar but enigmatic social patterns, such as circadian rhythms, lifestyle politics, the mesh of civilizations, the emergence and collapse of fads, the spread of self-destructive behaviors, cooperation in social dilemmas, the critical mass in collective action, the spread of complex contagions, the polarization of opinion, segregation of neighborhoods, and assimilation of minority cultures. 


Abstract:


In a paper co-authored with DellaPosta and Shi, the authors use a computational model that shows how social influence can amplify trivial differences to produce deep cultural cleavages in which ideological differences become aligned with leisure activities, consumer preferences, esthetic tastes, and ethical and moral choices. In this talk, Prof. Macy will build on that paper by presenting new results that use Twitter co-following and Amazon co-purchase networks to measure the cultural polarization of topics ranging from science to music.

Prof. Macy received his B.A. and Ph.D from Harvard and M.A. from Stanford.  His research has been published in leading journals, including Science, PNAS, American Journal of Sociology, American Sociological Review, and Annual Review of Sociology.

results.description:
A great way to get Dharma connected in New York!

For people interested in Buddhism or meditation or just leading a kinder life who are up for meeting like minded people.

Dharma Drink is now Self Service!

The table is always reserved in the same spot - just show up and see what happens  - just like if you were hanging out meeting other Buddhists randomly in Kathamandu or India. And don't take the RSVP too seriously - people are coming now who don't RSVP. The word is getting out....

Everyone is invited! Dharma Drink is all about building community amongst the Buddhist and like minded crowd in New York City. Greg the founder of Dharma Drink: "I was inspired to start Dharma Drink by hanging out with all of the great students of all of the different lamas in Kathmandu - Kagyu, Nyingma, Sakya, Gelugpa - totally Rimey (also Zen, Thai, Theravadan, yoga travelers, and the curious - just about everyone!).  We all became great friends and learned from each other." We're there every Friday night - see you there.


Motivation:  To make the Rubin Museum Lounge on Friday night the Buddhist and like minded hang-out spot in New York.

Who:  ALL ARE INVITED.  Feel free to spread the word.  The more,             the merrier.

Time:  7-?pm
Date:  Every Friday - like clockwork
Place:  Rubin Museum Lounge, 17th Street and 7th Avenue
How to find us:  Look for a table with the small sign "Dharma Drink"                          + Lounge staff  will know where we are.

Please see the following Meetups too!

Buddhist Events New York     and

Zen / Chan Buddhist Activities

www.dharmadrink.com
results.why: Because Buddhists and like minded people are great to hang-out with.
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be at a high-top table with little sign that says Dharma Drink, the high table overlooking the lower level and closest to the elevators - the lounge staff will know where we are in case you get totally lost.
results.name: Dharma Drink: the hang-out for Buddhists (& like minded)

results.description:
Dear Friends,

New York Italians in collaboration with Fordham University, and C.I.A.O
Cultural Italian Honor Society is very happy to invite you to:


"Italian Film Series at Fordham University"


Presentation and discussion of the film: NUOVOMONDO

-Golden Door-


The story is set at the beginning of the 20th century in Sicily. Salvatore, a very poor farmer, and a widower, decides to emigrate to the US with all his family, including his old mother. Before they embark, they meet Lucy. She is supposed to be a British lady and wants to come back to the States. Lucy, or Luce as Salvatore calls her, for unknown reasons wants to marry someone before to arrive to Ellis Island in New York. Salvatore accepts the proposal. Once they arrive in Ellis Island they spend the quarantine period trying to pass the examinations to be admitted to the States. Tests are not so simple for poor farmers coming from Sicily. Their destiny is in the hands of the custom officers.

Fordham University, Lincoln Center Campus
113 W 60th street, NY, NY
Room SL24L Friday, October 2nd 2015 at 6:30 PM 

English Subtitles 

Admission is free but space is limited.

PREFERENCE WILL BE GIVEN TO NEW YORK ITALIANS MEMBERS (membership card required: http://www.newyorkitalians.org/become-member/)

For info and reservations email us at [masked]

Grazie!

results.description:
This free workshop introduces the The Art of Living Foundation's seminal programs.  Over 40 million people worldwide have benefited from the Foundation's programs which teach simple yet powerful breathing and meditative techniques for reducing stress, anxiety, and fear, while increasing the potential for clarity, joy, and inner peace.

In the workshop we explore the connection between breath and meditation and state of mind.  Participants will experience the breath as a fundamental tool to unlocking a happier, more relaxed state of being with higher levels of awareness, focus and clarity.  We will experience the yoga of breath and end with a guided meditation.

Participants will also learn more about the additional course offerings at Art of Living Foundation which will allow them to develop a personal home practice. 

When:Friday 6:30pm-7:45pm

**Please arrive early for seating and registration

Where: 286 5th Ave  5th Floor (between 30th and 31st St) NY 10001
results.why: I Meditate NY is a movement empowering New Yorkers to do more things they love by recharging through meditation, a practical way to refresh every day, invented thousands of years ago. Reinvented in 2011. Our mission is to recharge New York!

We'll be using Cracking the Coding Interview (6th edition) by Gayle Laakmann McDowell. We will go over problems in the book as well as go over effective interviewing strategies.

This meetup runs every other Friday at this site. We also have a meetup that runs every other Thursday at another site, giving our members a weekly dose of Algorithms and Interview Prep if they want.

This Friday's meetup will focus on Chapter 4, "Trees and Graphs".

HOST:
Byte Academy is a programming and finance bootcamp based in NYC with a focus on preparing students for jobs at the intersection of programming and finance. Students will learn the fundamentals of programming and gain an in-depth understanding of its applicability in the financial sector.

results.description:
Hola amigos y amigas:


Join our Culture, Grammar & Conversation Workshops to improve your speaking and listening skills in Spanish in a fun and natural way. During the workshops an experienced instructor will help you develop the vocabulary and grammar structures necessary to be able to converse on various subjects of interest. We have two levels:

BEGINNERS & LOWER INTERMEDIATES

The workshops are very interactive, fun and stimulating. They are conducted by an experienced Spanish instructor who will correct mistakes, explain grammar and usage -whenever necessary- and highlight essential vocabulary for effective communication in Spanish.

COST: Just $15 per person, includes: workshop, printouts (if needed), pencil, fun!

IMPORTANT: Clicking "YES" without payment does not reserve a spot - ONLY ADVANCE PAYMENT DOES - This goes for ALL our events

--------------------------------------------------------------------------

LEVEL: LOWER INTERMEDIATES (B1*)

TIME: From 6:30pm to 8:00pm

TEACHER: Jorge Gallegos

****CLICK HERE TO PAY & REGISTER****

-----------------------------------------------------------------

LEVEL:  MIDDLE BEGINNERS and UP *

TIME: From 6:30pm to 8:00pm

TEACHER: María Angélica García

****CLICK HERE TO PAY & REGISTER****

---------------------------------------------------------------------------

(*) NOT SURE ABOUT YOUR LEVEL OF SPANISH? Visit HERE for some guidance.

Need to confirm your payment went through? Read ---> HERE

Previous Spanish Conversation Workshops for small groups were a big success! Read comments ---> HERE

**************************************

DETAILS
We'll have two groups running at the same time: Middle Beginners and Lower Intermediates.

Duration: 1 hour and 30 minutes per workshop

Jorge Gallegos and María Angélica García from Easy Espanol (www.easyespanol.org) will be your language coaches. Jorge is a skilled Spanish language instructor with over fourteen years of experience teaching Spanish as a second language. María Angélica is a dynamic instructor from Venzuela with a good sense of humor, very patient and a deep knowledge about contemporary cultural issues from the Spanish speaking world.

Please be aware that late tolerance is 15 minutes (you can't join a workshop if you are over 15 minutes late after 6:30pm).

ABOUT RSVP: Keep in mind that for all our paid events, RSVP does not guarantee a spot, only advance payment does

WHERE TO FIND US

The workshops will be held at 555 8th Avenue, Suite 110 (between 37th & 38th)

See where we are in a map---> HERE

CANCELLATIONS: You can cancel and get a full refund anytime up to 48 hours before your workshop start time. Read more HERE

¡Nos vemos!

Jorge

results.description:
Inner-Transition Workshop: Transformation of Consciousness

Deep Ecology & Living Systems in Transition

Date:  Friday, October 2nd, 2015

Time: 6:30-10:00pm

Place: Unitarian Universalist Congregation at Montclair

67 Church St, Montclair

(left-hand annex building, upstairs)

Convener:  Pamela Boyce Simms, Transition Trainer,

  Convener, Mid-Atlantic Transition Hub (MATH)

Event Sponsor: Transition Montclair

Contact:  Silke Springorum ([masked])

The self-organizing, ever-morphing Transition movement experiment in the Mid-Atlantic region is patterned after living-systems in nature.  This workshop highlights the essential inner work of the Transition movement and is designed to spark thoughts and generate conversations needed to transform consciousness. 

"Inner Transition," is the seed kernel at the heart of our movement. This workshop will be accessible to any social change agent who is at this crossroads or already traveling the path of sustained self, group, community, and/or societal transformation.

The Overarching Goal: is to catalyse networks’ evolution into communities of practice, and then toward humility-infused, impactful change-agent systems.

Workshop Goal:

Explain the dynamics of ‘living systems thinking’ as being key to peacefully navigating the complexity of life with clarity. Demonstrate how skillful self-observation work at multiple scales can facilitate tapping into collective genius, and create systemic, generative change. Brainstorm how we can deepen the social transformation we seek by applying living systems thinking to our work in an increasingly complex environment.

At the end of the workshop, participants will have tools to:

Reframe the complexity of our problems as welcome challenges and opportunities for positive growth and transformation, Learn to embrace the reality of perpetual uncertainty.

Suggested Donation: $20 to further the evolution of the Mid-Atlantic Transition Hub (MATH) and help cover the cost of the Transition Neighborhoods publication production.

results.description:
If you want to jump start your writing or you need a break from the novel you're working on, come join us. Just bring your own writing devices, I will provide prompts (if you have something you're working on you can work on that instead) and we'll write for 10 minutes straight. This is full- out, non-stop writing. Then we share- only if you want to- and do it again. We usually do this 2 times a meeting. It's a great way to get some words on the page. No prior reading or experience required to attend. You can leave early as we usually do this every half hour. Gotham Writer's Workshop charges $25 for this. Cost of this meetup? Free.

Jessica

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, timed it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds will be honored only with a minimum of 24 hour cancelation.  No refunds for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

The school entrance is located on East 109th street between 2nd and 3rd avenues (near 2nd avenue) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right) and someone will open the door for you.

For questions,  use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

Join us for 2 hours every “Friday Japanese / English Language Exchange!" In this event, you will get to learn about English and Japanese as well as socialize with other members! If you would like to practice and learn more English and Japanese, then this is your event!

毎週金曜日２時間実施される金曜日、英語日本語語学交流会にぜひお越し下さい！イベントでは日本語と英語を学ぶことはもちろんのこと、他のメンバーさんとの交流も楽しんで頂けます。

Details:

Lessons: Varying levels of Japanese and English lessons are given at multiple stations, focusing on aspects such as grammar, listening, and conversation.

Language Exchange: After the lessons, we have a free exchange for people in both languages.

詳細:

レッスン：文法、リッスニング、会話などに焦点をおいた日本語、英語のそれぞれのレベルに合わせたレッスンが受講できます。

語学交流会： レッスン後、両語学による自由な交流会をになります。

Time:

Every Friday, from 6:45pm to 8:45pm

Entrance fee: $5.00

Location:

Pearl Studios

500 8th Avenue 12th Floor New York, NY 10018

Ask for Room 1212!

If you arrive before 6:30pm, please wait downstairs. An organizer will be waiting with a sign and will bring you to the classroom when we are ready. If you arrive after 6:45pm, check in with the guard, and remember to bring a form of legal ID. Go to the 12th floor and look for us there!

Don't forget to bring a notebook!

Here are some pictures from our latest session!
