results.description:
I'll repeat the Google Wallet instructions for those unaccustomed: ***In the notes section of the payment, please leave your name and what event you are paying for! Thanks
-Download the Google Wallet app on your phone. You'll have to have a gmail account to register your username with this service if you don't already have gmail (in that case create a gmail account first... I did the same thing awhile back just to use this service)

- Create a 4 digit PIN to sign into Google Wallet. Then you'll be on the app homepage. -The left button says 'send money'. Click it and you'll have a screen where you can input a name or email address. My email address for this is [masked] .

-Once you input my username you'll see the screen where you type in the dollar amount. Once done, click the gray 'next', then the blue 'review' button in the upper right corner. -This takes to a confirmation screen. If anything looks off just click the left button on the upper lefthand side to go back a page. Otherwise, you confirm it and click send. Done! An icon will appear in your notifications area letting you know it's sent to me.

From now on, every event will not require a payment to rsvp on this page, I will check the rsvps daily to make sure everyone followed up - any issues message me on here and we will figure it out. Please work with me and send the payment when you register for the event... after this first set up it will take ten seconds each week. If you register and don't pay within 24 hours i'll reach out to you and then have to open the spot back up.. work with me here please, that would not be fun

8PM - Maximum Overdrive

Stephen King directed this movie based on his own story about machines (like your car, or your hair dryer) coming to life and trying to kill people. In the trailer he says "if you want to do something right, you'd better do it yourself". He also says "I'm going to scare the hell out of you, and that's a promise".


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ggWS4tTzs60

10 PM - Super Mario Brothers

The movie based on the video game franchise about a plumber jumping around a cute bright world. Features a bleak dystopian hellscape known as Dynohattan and a plumber who is afraid to jump. Also, Bowser is basically Donald Trump with spikier hair.


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KsGkMSY_Fag

Please arrive between 7 and 8. Drinks and snacks are appreciated as always.

results.description:
Join other single professionals for an early evening happy hour, topped off with about* 7-10 rounds of "mini-dates." You'll meet each member of the opposite sex for 5-7 minutes each (depending on the size of the event - EXPECT TO MEET 7 TO 12 MEMBERS OF THE OPPOSITE SEX*), turn in your dating card and then we'll send you the contact info of your mutual matches 48 hours later. On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

Get the full details below.

* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

PAYMENT POLICY:
$27- PAY IN ADVANCE ONLY - WE DO NOT ACCEPT PAYMENT AT DOOR

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: https://2015atwysspeeddatingnyc.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.
results.name: Speeddating Ages 26-39

results.description:
Vino- Versity- French Wine and French Cheese Pairing
Friday, October 2nd
1657 1st Avenue 86th/87th
7:00 pm – 9pm arrive 6:45 for seating
$47- Limited space RSVP asap
THIS WILL SELL OUT. MUST PAY ONLINE TO BE CONSIDERED RSVP-  no refunds. YOU MUST PAY ONLINE, any RSVP JUST ON HERE DOES NOT GET YOU A SEAT
http://thesinglegourmet.net/event/vino-versity-french-wine/

Our last event here was a sell out with over 10 on the waiting list, sign up soon for this one as we taste the wines and cheese of France. Try at last 6-10 tastings of wine with a full plate of French Cheese. If you love cheese and you love wine, then here's a perfect chance to sit in a room and taste how both cheese and wine change as you eat & sip them together. Through an array of French cheeses and French white, red, rosé, & sparkling wines, you will figure out which ones are magic together during this tasting! Your guide is a wine AND cheese expert working as a “cheese monger” at Lucy’s Whey and helped open Beechers Cheese in Flatiron! Approx. 2 hour lecture/discussion/tasting. A wonderful opportunity to taste the glorious Fromage of famed French regions, with soft & bloomy rinds, to hard & nutty selections, and of course: CHEVRE!! Beautiful whites, reds, & sparklers from Alsace, Burgundy, Bordeaux, The Rhone, The Loire, and/or Sudouest will accompany each sip!
results.name: SOLD OUT - French Wine and French Cheese pairing

results.description:
Join other single professionals for an early evening happy hour, topped off with about* 7-10 rounds of "mini-dates." You'll meet each member of the opposite sex for 5-7 minutes each (depending on the size of the event - EXPECT TO MEET 7 TO 12 MEMBERS OF THE OPPOSITE SEX*), turn in your dating card and then we'll send you the contact info of your mutual matches 48 hours later. On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

Get the full details below.

* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

$5 Draft Beers, House Wine, Well Mixed Drink

PAYMENT POLICY:
$27 - PAY IN ADVANCE ONLY - WE DO NOT ACCEPT PAYMENT AT DOOR

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: https://2015atwysspeeddatingnyc.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.

results.description:
All levels are welcomed. 

Each week we take on a different element of drawing. 

We begin with instruction on the drawing challenge of the week and then work for the remainder of the session from a still life. 


During our session I work with each attendee to talk about the work they are creating and their individual drawing challenges. 

This is the great way to improve your drawing skills. It is a combination of practice and theory in the same class. 

Since each attendee comes to the session at a different level and with different challenges it is my goal to work with each person individually. 

___________________________________________________

• Space is limited and the setting is wonderful. 

• Refreshments are served at the long break in the middle of the session. 

• Please bring a pad up to 16x20, a 2H, HB and 4B pencil and an eraser. 

• The price is $25 paid at the time of the class. 

• Please RSVP through this meetup so I know you are coming.  

I look forward to seeing you there!

Simon

Simon Levenson is the drawing instructor at The National Arts Club and teaches drawing at The Museum of The City of New York and The Morgan Library.

results.description:
Click Here To Sign Up Online

                                                 From 7:00pm-10:00pm

                     **An RSVP on meetup.com will not reserve your spot**

Tired of waiting on long lines or showing up 3 hours early to a gym just to try and get a spot. Well wait no more!

With Big City you also get to play on the same team as your friends when you show up.

Sign-Up in advance to participate in Big City Volleyball's weekly Open Play Friday evenings from 7:00pm – 10:00pm at The High School For Environmental Studies (444 West 56th Street betw. 9th & 10th Avenue), one of our premier gyms with two courts, conveniently located just a few blocks from Columbus Circle.

Who Can Participate:
Intermediate to Advanced players only! Players must be able to handle a free ball, pass accurately, serve consistently and play bump-set-spike vball rather than just retuning the ball to the other side of the court. (In Big City that's Divisions 3, 4 & 5). If you cannot do the above, you will be asked to leave. You don't have to currently play in the league to participate.

Where:
High School For Environmental Studies (444 West 56th Street - between 9th & 10th Avenue)

When:
Friday evenings Sept Thru June.

Times:
7:00pm - 10:00pm
  How Much:
$15 per session On-line in advance.


(ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS)
Only players who register on-line will be guaranteed a spot.
Players who pay at the door will not be given a spot to play until all on-line registered players have been checked in and then only if space permits.
Players who pay in advance will lose their spot if they arrive after check-in is complete.
Players can register in advance as many people as they like per session.
Players can Register in advance for as many sessions as they like.
*Must be 21 years old to participate.
*Only 48 spots per session.
(ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS)

How It Works
Each court will have up to three teams of 8 players. games will be to 21 points rally scoring. Players will sub in on dead balls. If a team wins two games in a row they must sit one game.

Big City prides itself on friendly competition. Please play fair and maintain respectable behavior towards your teammates and opponents. Call your own violations! (Nets, Sets and Out Balls). If you are rude in any manner or raise your voice you will be asked to leave and not allowed to participate again.
                                      ***Click Here Sign-Up On-Line In Advance***

Transform your habits with bestselling author and international life coach Shannon Kaiser.

 Spend an uplifting evening with Shannon Kaiser, founder of PlayWithTheWorld.com and author of the new book Adventures for Your Soul (Berkley/Penguin Aug 25th 2015). 

 This inspiring workshop will help you identify your limiting beliefs and remove them for good.

 Drawing from her own transformational experiences, Shannon’s program uses an empowering process that encourages you to go on adventures for your soul so you can

• Achieve your goals

• Remove limiting beliefs and self-sabotaging patterns

• Feel freedom from fear and live with purpose and passion

• Be unapologetic about your innermost desires

• And make happiness your natural way of life.

By focusing on how your life feels instead of how it looks on the outside, you can passionately experience your own life adventures. Shannon will guide you to live life to the fullest with this workshop and book signing. 

This event is part of the author’s first-ever national book tour stopping in six cities across the nation:

Come play with the world and meet Shannon Kaiser in person.

results.description:
My painting draws life. I love the town where I was born. I love the town where I live now. And I love Japan, all the countries of the world and the earth.

All the life on earth consists of curved lines. Flowing river, nice breeze, raging and strong wind, branches, wind of the sea and cloud floating in the sky, all of them consists of curved lines. Life resides in curved lines.

A life of a curved line is growing and growing, flies over the world and keeps going until the end of space. It continues to live without knowing the start and the end. As laughing, angering and despairing.

My lines will never be ended, eternally from here, and will keep alive forever by putting life on it. Living is loving. By putting love on lines, I hope that I can make a painting which grows forever round and round more and more.

Art is what I cannot live without for me. Because art makes me grow and tells me the truth.

Through the process of making a painting as art, I believe that I’ve made myself. When I start to draw a painting and face a painting, the painting never allows me to escape from the truth that I draw a painting even in difficult times.

By drawing a painting, I saw myself and faced myself, and I was taught gaining an insight into life and the truth that there was. I haven’t gotten away from the thing which I thought it was truth and the thing that there was. I’ve accepted it and faced it and I’ve repeatedly thought about and been distressed at the true meaning of living.

I face up to the thing in front of me and I draw what I feel. At that time, I deeply feel a sense of fulfillment of live and repeat a pleasure and a pain of live several times in my mind. And when I finish a painting, I always sense happiness about that I am allowed to live, mystery of life and being life.

venue.name: Meet at Lexington's in the Cort Hotel

results.description:
Please read carefully: This event is being sponsored by Dave Cervini's newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people registered on this Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending please contact the event host at [masked].

A scavenger hunt and party rolled into one! Join us for this fun evening where you will get to meet awesome people, explore one of NYC's iconic landmarks and enjoy a great party with the friends you have already made on the Scavenger Hunt!   It is a fun and different way to spend a Wednesday.

How it works:  Join us for check in from 6:30-7pm at Lexington's Lounge in the Cort Hotel on 39th and Lexington.  Have a drink, socialize and unwind from the days work.  Upon check-in we’ll group people together into teams of 4 or 5.  One person in your group will need to have a camera or camera phone.  After we have everyone checked in you will have 75 minutes to find all the clues we have sent you out to find!

At the end of 75 minutes your team will come back to Lexington's for food, drink and fun conversations about what you just experienced. We will tally up the scores and announce the winners.

The teams with the most points will win prizes.

Cost: $10  Please bring exact change

Level: No prior knowledge needed of anything… just have fun.

Can I come alone?  Yes most attending will have signed up on their own.

What to wear: Anything (but you may find yourself running)

What to bring: A charged phone or Android device (don’t worry if you don’t have one, we’ll group you into a team that does)

What’s included?
- A fun and crazy time playing
- Meeting new people
- Prizes

There does not seem to be a lot of people registered on this Meet Up, are there more people going?

  Yes as explained, this event is being promoted by several Meet Up groups and

www.newyorksocialnetwork.com

.  There will be tons of people attending.  If you have any questions you can contact the event organizer directly at [masked] or call[masked]

An Iranian man reunites with his estranged wife (Bérénice Bejo) in Paris to finalize their divorce, which is soon complicated by a shocking revelation by her daughter from a previous marriage. Beautifully written, sensitively directed, and powerfully acted, The Past serves as another compelling testament to Asghar Farhadi's gift for finely layered drama.

 Disussion to follow screening

To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.

*You can take this workshop even if you didn't take Part 1*

IMPROV FOR ACTORS - THE BASICS- Part 2

This Improve with Improv Workshop is the second of two workshops* that will focus on learning basic improv techniques which include theater games,movement exercises and scene work designed to help the performer be more spontaneous, focused and aware. The participants will learn skills that help them to break out of their comfort zones and explore new creative territory.


Many actors get “stuck in their heads” and as a result feel paralyzed and/or disconnected when performing. Improv skills give the actor tools that will get them out of their heads and into the scene.


A fun, safe and non-competitive environment is created in which each participant will learn how to work through inhibitions and tap into their imaginations.


*you do not have to attend Part 1 in order to attend Part 2

results.description:
How to be unconditionally happy?

A mind that is calm, without anticipation and agitation is the birth right of all individuals. A mind that is in the present moment will be happy.

What can get you to that state?

The rest you gain by reposing in yourself is deeper than the deepest sleep. The deeper your rest, the more dynamic your activity is. By being peaceful and happy you can turn your body into a power-house by generating an inner source of energy.

Meditation & breathing techniques are simple and is a practical way to recharge and rejuvenate; empowering you to do more of the things you love.

Come join us for free guided session and experience the power of meditation.

Workshop Contents:

- Understanding the nature of the mind
- Relaxing Breathing Techniques
- Guided Meditation
- Introduction to the Happiness Course and Sudarshan Kriya

“Benefits Reported by participants: - Reduced Stress & Increased Productivity - Increased Joy & Happiness - Enhanced Focus & Concentration - Improved Relationships”

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no 

displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP ,  24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

The school entrance is located on East 109th street between 2nd and 3rd avenues (near 2nd avenue) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right) and someone will open the door for you.

For questions,  use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

**Note** Please be courteous to other meet up members.  If you are unable to attend, update your RSVP to "No" prior to event time.  Thank you in advance.

results.description:
Can't tell the difference between the Yankees and the Red Sox(and don't care to)? Do you miss the multiple references to Sesame Street and Twilight (and don't miss missing them)? Then this group is for you!

We are a bunch of global transplants to New York, who want to form meaningful friendships with other international folks new to New York. This is not a business networking group, nor a singles meet-market nor any kind of "take a cut on your drinks" broker, just a fun, informal place for internationals new to New York--and those who love them--to connect.

If you are up for a glass of beer and a good conversation on books, travel, the life you've left behind and the one you are about to embark on or anything under the sun (or the roof of a bar), come by and make a few good friends.
results.name: The International Happy Hour: For NY's global citizens--and those who love them!

group.name: The New York International Happy Hour

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KlDPuMW6Ats

Now for the important coordination info. First, go to this website. You should pick October 2nd @ 8:30 PM. Don't worry about the minimum 2 tickets, I have already bought 2 so the game will happen. Get as many as you want, but get them for 8:30 PM.

We will meet inside the complex. Keep an eye on the comments section for this event for the latest information. I will send out my phone number on the day of the event to people that RSVP.

After the game is over and we have caught our breaths we can hit up some bars. LIC has a ton of them.

results.description:
RSVPs open 3 days prior to event. 

Please pay online by game time.
If you don't get the payment prompt from Meetup, you can send a paypal payment of $15 to [masked].

Here's the link to pay: paypal.me/catsvolleyball

Friday Night Meetups begin at 8pm and end at 10:30

This evening is for Beginners-to-Intermediate. Perfect for folks new to the group. RSVPS open at 12:30 noon on Tuesdays! 

Come out, get a great workout and make new friends!!

GAME RULES:

-On serves only one REDO will be granted per player per game on first serve. (Can hit any obstacle (except lighting) and ball cannot be going out of bounds on sides) After a successful serve(s), no redos! (Beneficial to players waiting to sub in)

- NO REDOS on ceiling obstacles only on WIRE (less arguing, will speed up games)

-If each team fouls they both will cancel each other and a redo will be played immediately 

-No Net touches top or bottom (For Safety of all players)

results.description:
ALL LEVELS ARE WELCOME

(If you are a beginner and wish to join the party, please come for a brief rating session before joining the party.  This is a social tennis group, rather than an instructional session.)

Also check out my website:

www.tennis-buffs.com

 

If you sign up via Meet Up site, you must call me to find out your start time.  I would like to stagger players.  You may or may not be able to start at 8pm, as it depends on how many spots there are left.  Thank you for your understanding.

 


Fridays, start 8pm
Cost $40, includes tennis, balls and food
6 Indoor hard courts

 

What better way to spend an evening than to be with people with common interests, playing tennis and meeting old and new friends.

 

It's a melting pot of wonderful cultures. You will play friendly and yet competitive matches. Off the courts, you will meet people and be engaged in conversations in a relaxed and congenial atmosphere.

If you are new to Tennis Buffs, please be sure to answer the survey so I know how to match you up with other players in a doubles game.  You can choose to play as many hours as you wish.  Just tell me when you RSVP, when you arrive, or before the next scheduled match.

Look forward to meeting old and new friends!

Penny Jung
Event Coordinator
www.tennis-buffs.com

results.description:
Gotham Atheists weekly Drinking With Atheists Friday Night Socials!

Join us for a great night of conversation in relaxed company in New York City. We go from 8pm to around 11pm or so.

This week we will be going to the new UES location of Mel's Burger Bar, located at[masked]nd avenue between 75th and 76th street. You can check out their delicious menus here: http://melsburgerbar.com/ 

Please sign up early and keep your RSVP status accurate because we will be reserving a party space. I will post below if we are large enough to qualify for group rates on food/drink. The more people we have the more likely we can get the discount.

(Please note, this new Mel's Burger Bar location is so new that it does not yet show up on any social service like Yelp, Google, etc. Do not expect these sites to help you find the location unless you are using the physical address of[masked]nd avenue their direct number is [masked] .)


Every Friday Night for 8 years we have gathered to enjoy the evening and the company of each other. DWA (Drinking With Atheists) is for Atheists, agnostics, Skeptics, Philosophers, Humanists, Freethinkers, Brights, secularists, inquiring minds, and all around nice people. No agenda but good light conversations. Great chance to meet new people and make new friends.


See you Friday Night.

Lee 

[masked]

results.description:
We are excited to announce that our first monthly beginner series starts on Sept 18th Friday at 8pm.  No partners or experience necessary.  We will switch partners often during the class so that you get to meet lots of new dancers.  Please find more details below and register before Sept 11th to get early discount!!  Looking forward to dancing with you!

We have two beginner swing dancing classes for you to choose from: Class 1: 6 count basics, Class2: Charleston & Balboa. First hour will be the lesson and then we will dance and socialize for half an hour.

This is a monthly series consisting of 4 classes.  We will meet every Friday (except for Sept 4).  Dates are Sept 18, 25 and Oct 2nd and 9th.  Although drop ins are welcome every week, we highly recommend to take all 4 classes so that you will be comfortable executing new moves on the social dance floor! 

Venue:(please note that this is a different venue from the welcome party!!!)

Flushing Dance Club
137-02 Northern Blvd. Flushing, NY11354<a>
[masked]</a>

Schedule:

9/18, 9/25, 10/2, 10/9  Fridays
8-9pm Lindy Hop Basics (6 count with triple steps) OR Balboa Basics
9-9:30 Social party (we will dance with each other, socialize and drink!!)

Fee:

Monthly Pass (4 classes) 
Early Bird Discount: $50, At Door $60

Single Class  $17

Registration and Payment:

To register, please go to this Registration page:  

http://goo.gl/forms/exjqCZXWjj


Note: if you have already paid and registered for the classes at the welcoming party, you don't need to register again. On the registration page, you can choose one of these payment options:
1. Paypal to [masked] by Sept 11th
2. Pay via Facebook  (https://www.facebook.com/a.townfun) by Sept 11th 
3. Mail a check by Sept 8th (please email us at [masked] to find out our mailing address)
4. Pay cash at door on Sept 18th (but you will not be qualified for the early bird discount rate). 

The class size is limited.  Please register and pay asap to guarantee your spot!!

results.description:
I'll repeat the Google Wallet instructions for those unaccustomed: ***In the notes section of the payment, please leave your name and what event you are paying for! Thanks
-Download the Google Wallet app on your phone. You'll have to have a gmail account to register your username with this service if you don't already have gmail (in that case create a gmail account first... I did the same thing awhile back just to use this service)

- Create a 4 digit PIN to sign into Google Wallet. Then you'll be on the app homepage. -The left button says 'send money'. Click it and you'll have a screen where you can input a name or email address. My email address for this is [masked] .

-Once you input my username you'll see the screen where you type in the dollar amount. Once done, click the gray 'next', then the blue 'review' button in the upper right corner. -This takes to a confirmation screen. If anything looks off just click the left button on the upper lefthand side to go back a page. Otherwise, you confirm it and click send. Done! An icon will appear in your notifications area letting you know it's sent to me.

From now on, every event will not require a payment to rsvp on this page, I will check the rsvps daily to make sure everyone followed up - any issues message me on here and we will figure it out. Please work with me and send the payment when you register for the event... after this first set up it will take ten seconds each week. If you register and don't pay within 24 hours i'll reach out to you and then have to open the spot back up.. work with me here please, that would not be fun

Location? Q.E.D. A Place To Show And Tell [masked]rd Avenue Astoria, NY 11105)

When? First Friday of every month, 9PM! 

Come enjoy a fun art night focused on figure drawing from a live model. No teaching or instruction, just a casual place to unwind after the work week, meet local creatives, refresh your artistic skills, or drink until you're talented! No need to be a pro, stick figures and hand-turkey’s welcome! Bring your friends or enjoy an evening of creative exploration and meeting local artists.  Bring your own materials. Some materials will be available for purchase.

twitter: @Astoria_DnDraw

Witching & Bitching (2016; Spanish with English subtitles)

A gang of escaping jewellery thieves get trapped by a coven of witches.

Then the next one will take us back to the good old days of the 80s (actually 1987) with one of the classics:

The Monster Squad (1987)

A young group of monster fanatics attempt to save their hometown from Count Dracula and his army of monsters.

https://youtu.be/ls8ZJAwv5OM

I do hope that you can make it to this event & hope to get to meet you finally if this is your first time. have a great day

results.description:
Rio-born Brazilian jazz composer/singer/pianist Luiz Simas is a genuine Carioca! A New Yorker since ‘89, he has led original groups in jazz festivals and clubs in the US, in Europe and in Brazil. Luiz' voice and music have warmed major venues including Birdland, the Weill Recital Hall at Carnegie Hall and Bargemusic. His CDs include Cafune, Impromptu, Luiz Simas Live in NYC, New Chorinhos from Brazil, Recipe for Rhythm and Mata Atlântica (Atlantic Forest) Piano Suite.

The repertoire includes Luiz's infectious original tunes as well as beloved Brazilian music standards by Jobim, Caetano Veloso and others.

Luiz Simas Trio: Luiz Simas (piano), Adriano Santos (drums), Itaiguara (bass) and special guest Julia Haughton (vocals)


General admission is $25. Click here to purchase your ticket. Note: we are not selling tickets through the meetup group.

For more information, check Luiz Simas Trio's FB page<a href="https://www.facebook.com/events/1613448628927802/"></a>

results.description:
Welcome to Early Bird English, the fun and interesting way to improve your conversation skills early in the day -- without cutting into the rest of your weekend!  PLEASE NOTE THAT THIS MEETUP WILL BE STARTING A HALF-HOUR LATER, AT 7:30, TO BETTER ACCOMMODATE OUR MEMBERS!


Leader Eve will supply plenty to discuss, but feel free to bring along an English-language passage that you have enjoyed or found puzzling. We'll all take a look and discuss what it means.

 Early Bird English is founded on the idea that people learn best when they are enjoying themselves. Each session is quickly paced, friendly, and meant to challenge.

Eve charges a small, non-refundable fee for each session, which helps to cover the cost of the website as well as her preparation.   Please note that the $10 fee DOES NOT cover the cost of coffee! 

http://thejoyofenglish.org/

When we learn with pleasure, we never forget.

-- Alfred Mercier

"Lenovo is one of a growing number of multinationals from the non-Anglophone world that have made English their official language."

-- The Economist, 2/15/14

"A strong vocabulary may be your ticket to side-stepping dementia," says a new study from researchers in Spain.  "...An ample vocab is an indication of robust cognitive reserves, a surplus of neurons that help the brain compensate for memory lapses..." 

-- Prevention, April 2015

"It might have been easier to learn a language years ago, but still, I'm having fun...I was heartened to see, just a month or so ago, a Penn State study suggesting that learning a new language can improve your brain function.  It can, in the researcher's words, 'lead to more graceful aging.'" 

-- Tina Hay, editor, The Penn Stater, March/April 2015

"The average American speaks one language.  Be more than average."

-- magazine ad for Rosetta Stone
results.name: Let's talk!

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there 15 minutes earlier so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. 

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and throw-ins and 6'x15' big goals. Rotate goalies

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 134th street and Amsterdam Ave. Click on this Google link for location: Click here.

Directions: By train: 1 train to 137th St. City College Station

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time sharp. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a credit for any future game (please email me to issue the credit) This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, an automated e-mail will be sent letting you know that a spot has just openned :). You can also check our calendar for other games. Click here for calendar.

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text or call Mane at[masked]-6601.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

The train only runs twice an hour and the first "meet and greet" at the expo usually begins at 9:30am.  I know that Charli 2.0 has benefited from my attendance at this seminar for the last two years!


I figure we need a few minutes to meetup prior to departure time so 8am should be ok for the 8:25am departure.  The walk from the station is about 10-15 minutes on Long Island.

http://thecolorrun.com/brooklyn/

http://thecolorrun.com/brooklyn/

http://thecolorrun.com/brooklyn/

The Color Run is a five-kilometer, un-timed race in which thousands of participants, or “Color Runners”, are doused from head to toe in different colors at each kilometer. With only two rules, the idea is easy to follow: 


1) Wear white at the starting line. 2) Finish plastered in color! The fun continues after Color Runners complete the race with an unforgettable Finish Festival. This larger than life party is equipped with music, dancing and massive color throws.


A few of us participated in the July Color Run and had SO much fun! This 5K is really laid back and includes a dance party afterwards! Fellow group member Danielle Jones already has a team called "Star Bright" so we can register with her. Team registration is $45 per person vs $50 for individuals.

Register here (Saturday, October 3rd 9:15 AM Run/Walk/Dance/Cartwheel/Party Wave option): https://endurancecui.active.com/event-reg/select-race?e=23154354&_ga=1.104781440.1610680313.1433162977

**Team: Star Bright**

Find more info on the race here: http://thecolorrun.com/brooklyn/

Can't wait, ladies!!

Mbali

results.description:
Service providers & Speakers needed for the Harlem Home Buyer Expo, Saturday, October 3rd, 8:30AM - 4:00PM. 

Harlem Congregations for Community Improvement, Inc. (HCCI) and Harlem Community Development Corporation will be hosting a Harlem Home Buyer Expo at Adam Clayton Powell State Office Building located on 163 West 125th Street, New York, NY. The purpose for this one day event is to promote homeownership through education and within the Harlem community. The Expo will be held on the Adam Clayton Powell, Jr. PLAZA located in front of the state office building and there will also be seminars IN the State Office Building.

Over twenty local community lenders who will be available to speak with prospective home buyers about mortgage products and offer on the spot pre-approvals. There will also be workshops on financial literacy, the home buying process and available grant programs. Plus, several panel discussions on current home buying trends, rising home values and other housing related topics. 

Over 2500 people are expected to attend throughout the day to participate in the event. The goal of the expo is to reach out to prospective first time home buyers to offer information and assistance to them in navigating through the home buying process.


The Reverend Charles Butler of the HCCI needs the following Service providers:
~ Property Insurance Providers
~ Agents WITH listings
~ Other Real Estate related service providers (MORTGAGE LENDER SPOTS are FULL)- if you think your company is a good fit, please contact Rev. Butler DIRECTLY (see below).

The Reverend Charles Butler of the HCCI needs the following Speakers:
~ Financial literacy
~ The home buying process
~ Grant programs
~ Home buying trends 
~ Rising home values 
~ Other housing related topics

If you think you or your company is a good fit, please contact Rev. Butler DIRECTLY (see below).

In addition, help is needed financing the event and donations by service providers and speakers are greatly appreciated. 

Please respond DIRECTLY to:
Dr. Charles Butler
Vice President of Equitable Development
and Human Capital Development

results.description:
Rockland Lake State Pk Loop!
Saturday, Oct. 3rd
Where: GW Bride (178th St. & Ft. Washington, under bridge) 'A' train to 175th street.
Time: 8:45am, on the pedals by 9:am
Distance: 50-55 miles pacing at 17mph on flats
Terrain: Somewhat hilly and challenging.
Level: intermediate/advance
Fee: $10 support and guidance

The following is not intended this to discourage you, but inform you. I actually have a later start time in hope that more of you will come. This intermediate ride is intended to challenge your stamina, introduce you to some real hills and prepare you for Bear Mountain in the weeks to come. You should know how to manage your gears for speed and for climbing. There are some parts of the route where the road is narrow, the cars are close and moving fast bring your bike handling skills into play. Stops will be limited and may push your endurance level. Bring snacks to munch on while cycling, not sure when or where we'll stop to eat, restrooms...yes! Once we reach Rockland State Pk we'll lap the lake before heading back over the mountain to Toga bike shop for a break at the 28 mile mark. This is not a ride to somewhere to eat ride, you eat what you or buy at the bike shop (mostly nutrition bars). Then we'll make our way back to the city. The return is hilly, if need we'll re-route.

The fall temperature is here, so dress accordingly yet try not to over dress. Currently light showers are on the forecast for Saturday, if it's light showers we still ride, heavy is a no go. I will update you on ride status again come Thursday.

If you are considering this challenge I encourage you to get out and ride during the week at least 20 miles at once with may be one shortly break. Your bike should be equipped with an odometer to keep track of your speed and milage. Have the necessaries to repair a flat tire should you get one.

I'm thinking of having a SAG vehicle to support and follow us. I usually arrange for this when we cycle more than 50 miles with no bailout, hint!!!

So, are you REALLY READY TO RIDE???
Avery
results.name: Rockland Lake Loop!!! ***POSTPONED due to weather***

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there 15 minutes earlier so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. 

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and throw-ins and 6'x15' big goals. Rotate goalies

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 134th street and Amsterdam Ave. Click on this Google link for location: Click here.

Directions: By train: 1 train to 137th St. City College Station

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time sharp. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a credit for any future game (please email me to issue the credit) This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, an automated e-mail will be sent letting you know that a spot has just openned :). You can also check our calendar for other games. Click here for calendar.

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text or call Mane at[masked]-6601.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
We'll meet in front of the Red Barn Bakery for a run on the Old Croton Aqueduct. Afterward, whoever is interested can head to the Red Barn Bakery for breakfast. This is a good run for new runners because it is out and back - no set distance to cover but you will need to wear a watch. Feel free to turnaround at any point or walk/run at your own pace. 

Details about the Saturday run

Route: We’ll meet in front of the Red Barn Bakery (4 S. Astor St.) in Irvington and jog VERY casually together to the Old Croton Aqueduct trail. (If you are unfamiliar with the area and would prefer to walk rather than run to the trail, click here to see the trail on a map.) From there we’ll head south toward Dobbs Ferry. There is no set distance. Everyone will walk or run at their own pace for 25 minutes, and then turn around and come back. Please wear a watch so that you know when to turn around.

Water/Bag Storage: There are very few water fountains along the route, so bring a water bottle if you need one while running. I’ll bring water and cups for after the run. There’s no bag storage, so leave belongings at home or in your car.

Location: In front of Red Barn Bakery (4 S. Astor St, Irvington, NY 10533). Free parking is available on weekends in the MetroNorth lot next door.

</a>  <a href="https://www.facebook.com/groups/1452433901730637/">Join our Facebook group to post pictures or message other members.

General advice & guidelines for our regular meetup runs:

• RSVP if you are going. If your plans change, simply change your RSVP.

• There is no bag storage, so please bring only what you plan to run with.

• All regular runs are rain or shine, unless the weather is actually dangerous.

• If you arrive late, can’t find the start location, miss us for any reason, run anyway!

• If you missed RSVP deadline, and know our starting point, feel free to join us on the day – just this one time :)

Feel free to contact me either via my meetup account or at [masked] if you have any questions.

The GoBridge initiative:

GoBridge, as a part of Bridge Foundry, is dedicated to building bridges that educate and empower underrepresented communities to teach technical skills and foster diversity in tech. To learn more about Bridge Foundry please check out our website, http://bridgefoundry.org.

This workshop:

Right after GothamGo, we will be offering an Ardan Labs Hardcore Go workshop for FREE October 3rd and 4th at Digital Ocean in NYC. This class provides an intensive, comprehensive and idiomatic view of the language. The class will focus on both the specification and implementation of the language, including topics ranging from language syntax, Go’s type system, concurrency, channels and more. For details, see the Hardcore Go repo, https://github.com/ArdanStudios/gotraining.

This class is for you if:

- you identify as a woman

- you are an intermediate-level developer

- you have some experience with other programming languages

- you want to learn Go, or you want a more thorough understanding of the language and its internals

About our sponsor, Digital Ocean:
https://www.digitalocean.com/company/about/

results.description:
This presentation will focus on having students evaluate each others’ work, developing computer science skills through analyzing errors in code. Teachers will learn how to assist students in empowering themselves to conduct their own assessment of their work.

Hi everyone!

Sean and I are excited to unveil the first iteration of the CS Pedagogy Meetup. We alluded to this at the end of last year and were already experimenting w/ the format. The goal of the new name and format is to provide a space for CS teachers to share and exchange valuable pedagogical knowledge and practice from their classrooms. More specifically, at each meetup we plan on highlighting knowledgeable teachers and providing them a platform to present on a high leverage practice or set of practices they use in teaching CS.

To that end, each meetup will have a few presentations / workshops for attendees to choose from (starting with 4 sessions, 2 running concurrently). By the end of the year, we’ll have a repository of lessons that cater to a wide audience with content/strategies that cover both advanced and novice material. The sessions themselves will be 75-90 min total, including Q&A. These talks will not just be slides / one way sharing of learnings. For each session, we want the educators to actively engage with the topic--the more interactive the better (production of artifact and/or engagement in an activity). Also attendees should be able to take at least one practice back from the session and implement it in their classroom.

For the inaugural CS Pedagogy Meetup, we are honored to have Dr. Cynthia Solomon, one of the creators of LOGO with us, along with other experienced educators. We are still finalizing all the topics, so check back :)


> Cynthia Solomon - Computer Cultures: Logo, Scratch and Beyond
I plan on looking at Logo and Scratch as two coding environments designed specifically for kids. They were both heavily influenced by Seymour Papert and his thinking about children, computers, and powerful ideas. Each has lead to its own computer cultures as formed by the interactions of teachers and learners. Creative, playful, imaginative experiences are likely. However, teacher influences on project choices and their views of the merits of debugging strongly influence what kids do and how they think about what they are doing.

> Eric Allatta - CSP Approaches and Strategies
Computer Science Principles (CSP) is a new Advanced Placement® course designed to expand participation in computer science by expanding the breadth of computer science curriculum. Students read and write much more in CSP than in a traditional CS course. CSP also demands large stretches (23 hours) of student-structured class time. This workshop will focus on a variety of approaches and strategies that assist the teacher in preparing students for the success on the course assessments. Eric is a CS teacher at the Academy for Software Engineering (AFSE) and intrepid leader of the evening meetup series.

> Jason Bissonnette - Peer Evaluation and Error Analysis
This presentation will focus on having students evaluate each others’ work, developing computer science skills through analyzing errors in code. Teachers will learn how to assist students in empowering themselves to conduct their own assessment of their work.


Jason is a CS teacher at the Eagle Academy for Young Men. Here is a video of Jason talking about his involvement w/ TEALS. Jason is also part of the SEP program. 

> Sean Stern - Reading CS: Explicit Strategies to Help EVERY Student Engage with CS Textbooks, Tutorials, and Guides
CS education at the secondary and post-secondary levels often assume students come prepared to independently comprehend technical CS texts like textbooks, self-guided tutors, and forums. However, only 1/3 of NYC public school students enter high school reading on grade level. To help ALL students engage with technical writing, it's imperative that teachers who use such texts (or wish to prep students for environments that will) provide students with active reading comprehension strategies. My talk focuses on my initial attempts to do so at the Academy for Software Engineering (AFSE)--a limited, unscreened NYC public high school in Manhattan--followed by a workshop where attendees attempt to build lessons around texts used in their own classrooms. Feel free to bring along a copy of a CS text used in your classroom for the workshop!

Sean is a CS teacher at the Academy for Software Engineering (AFSE) and the fearless leader of the CS Pedagogy Meetup! Here's a video from a previous meetup of Sean talking about transitioning from Scratch to other languages.

We will start PROMPTLY at 9:45am, so please arrive on time. Breakfast and lunch will be served. 

Stay tuned for more info. If you would like to present or nominate someone, please get in touch :) The next iteration of the Pedagogy Meetup will be Nov 7th.

Cheers,
Cindy
results.name: Inaugural CS Pedagogy Meetup w/ Special Guest!

results.description:
LEADER: Dean Gletsos ([masked] or[masked] (h)[masked] (c))

RATING: B 7 B

We will take the Timp-Torne and other trail in the area. Fantastic views of Hudson river and vicinity. Lunch with a view too. We go over Dunderberg and Bald mountains. We may even visit the Timp. Back via Timp-Torne trail. Bring plenty of fluids, a smile and dress for the occasion. If in doubt, re. weather cancellation, please call. Please, register for this hike. TC Harriman Bear Mt. Northern, map 119.

*   *   *   *   *   *

Our full hike schedule can be viewed on our website at hudsonhikers.org, and some hikes are also posted on our Facebook page.

After attending two hikes/events, please consider joining the North Jersey Ramapo Chapter of the Adirondack Mountain Club to support our outdoor recreation and conservation activities.  Membership comes with a variety of benefits including a 10% discount at Ramsey Outdoor; our annual holiday party and social; special events such as our traditional day-outing to the Mohonk Mountain House; a subscription to ADK’s bi-monthly magazine, Adirondac; and the opportunity to contribute to the preservation and extension of hiking lands and viewsheds in our region.

New hikers are strongly encouraged to select hikes appropriate to their capabilities. North Jersey Ramapo Chapter hikes are rated for pace (A, B or C), mileage, and terrain (A, B or C), with "C" designating easier hikes and "A" more challenging ones. We recommend that new hikers should first try a "C" or short "B" hike before undertaking a more difficult one; otherwise, you may not fully enjoy the hiking experience. If you have any doubts, please contact the hike leader in advance. 

Pace Ratings: 
     A = Fast - 2.5 mph or faster 
     B = Moderate - about 2 mph 
     C = Easy - 1.5 mph or less 

Distance:Noted in miles 

Terrain Ratings:
     A = Strenuous, long/steep climbs and descents, 
             possible rock scrambling
     B = Moderate climbs and descents
     C = Generally flat with little elevation change 

For example, a hike rated “B 7 A” is a moderately paced hike of approximately 7 miles with steep climbs and/or descents and possible rock scrambling. 

If you join us for a hike, please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness, including ensuring that the hike is appropriate for your level of fitness, that you wear the proper clothing, and bring the proper gear, food and water (see the ADK's recommended Hiking Essentials and guidelines, below).

Leaders have the right, responsibility and sole discretion to refuse any hiker he/she deems to be not properly attired, prepared, or otherwise fit to safely complete the hike. 

HIKERS' GUIDELINES:

  Risks:  As with all physical activities, hiking involves hazards. Persons participate at their own risk and will be asked to sign a statement acknowledging that fact before starting the hike. Prior to the hike please advise the leader of any medical condition or physical impairment that could affect you during the hike.

  Footwear and Clothing:  Wear clothing suited to the weather and carry extra garments for unexpected weather conditions. Dress in thin layers so that you can adjust the number of layers as required to maintain comfort. In winter carry a wool cap and wool or polypropylene gloves or mitts and a windproof shell. Be prepared for rain. Bring a rain jacket and rain pants, preferably of the type that permits venting body moisture. Wear comfortable, sturdy boots/shoes.  Do not wear cotton garments in winter.

  Drink and Food:  Adequate hydration is important year round. Drink frequently during the hike. Carry food to enjoy during the midday lunch stop.

  Other responsibilities:  Hikers with children under 16 and new hikers are required to contact the hike leader in advance to determine if the hike is suitable for them.  Minors under 16 are welcome on day hikes when accompanied by a parent or guardian.  No person under 18 shall participate in overnight outings unless accompanied by a parent or adult sponsor over 21.  The hike leader may refuse to allow a person to hike who is judged to be poorly equipped or unable to do the published hike.  Participants should get to the hike at least 10 minutes prior to the starting time.

  Maps:  The TC number indicates a NY-NJ Trail Conference map for the area of the hike. For example: TC-118 refers to the Southern Harriman Park map.

  Abbreviations:  NCA-No Calls After . . . , Pref.- Leader’s contact preference.

  Expense Sharing:  When car-pooling, passengers are expected to offer the driver funds sufficient to cover the cost of fuel, tolls and parking fees. A $3.00 minimum per person is recommended. Most hike trailhead meeting locations can be found on NY-NJ Trail Conference maps.

  Dog-Friendly Hikes:  Pets are not permitted on hikes unless the hike description clearly states that it is "dog friendly."  If it is, all hikers with dogs must abide by park leash regulations.
results.name: Meandering Around Dunderberg Mt.

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there 15 minutes earlier so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. 

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and throw-ins and 6'x15' big goals. Rotate goalies

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 134th street and Amsterdam Ave. Click on this Google link for location: Click here.

Directions: By train: 1 train to 137th St. City College Station

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time sharp. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a credit for any future game (please email me to issue the credit) This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, an automated e-mail will be sent letting you know that a spot has just openned :). You can also check our calendar for other games. Click here for calendar.

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text or call Mane at[masked]-6601.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
NOTE :    This isn't Jungian/Analytical

Here is the link : http://www.nypsi.org/#Event/30364

TOPIC :   Consciousness and the Unconscious

LOCATION : The Marianne & Nicholas Young Auditorium 247 E. 82nd Street NYC 

Free and open to the public. RSVP is appreciated but not required; first come, first-seated.

If the id is conscious, as Dr. Solms believes it is, then where and what is 'the unconscious'? And likewise, how does the theory of a conscious id change our conception of repression? And what are the implications of this change for psychoanalytic technique? In this presentation, he will address these three questions in turn, while trying to forge an integrated view of the 'conscious' and 'unconscious' in psychoanalysis and cognitive neuroscience, two disciplines that have studied these fundamental mental things extensively but which seem to mean quite different things by the words.
results.how_to_find_us: Arrive early to procure a seat. Go to the 2nd floor.
results.name: Consciousness and the Unconscious

results.description:
Harvest autumn energy on next Dance Walk in Prospect Park! Bring your own ipod & earbuds. We dance walk around the park loop. What is dance walking? It's an improvised form of walking, with music, doing whatever movement comes naturally. It's walking and moving your arms. Or skipping, skitching, low-stepping, sideways running. It's responding to the rhythm, attitude, or story of the music you're hearing. In short, it's having a dance party in your living room, while walking through the park--hilarious and exhilarating. For inspiration, check out:

www.24hoursofhappy.com

results.description:
Special Opportunity: 
One-day Workshop on Sustainable Living 
with Lonnie Gamble

Learn how New York City is already one of the greenest cities in the country, and find out how transcending is ultimately the source of the green revolution. Discover what New Yorkers are doing to make the city more sustainable and learn some practical skills for sustainable living.

Workshop Leader: Lonnie Gamble - Director of the Sustainable Living Department at Maharishi University of Management in Fairfield, Iowa


Date: October 3rd, 2015
Time: 10:00 - approximately 5:00PM
Admission price: $ 30
Location: Downtown TM Center, 26 Beaver St, NYC

Register for this Workshop -->

This workshop will start at the Downtown TM Center (26 Beaver St, NYC) and will include practical hands on skills for New Yorkers. Depending on interest of those present at the Saturday workshop, we'll discuss from amongst these topics:

• Composting & Apartment worm composting

• Food Production / Apartment Food:
Production:Sprouts and microgreens 
Container gardening
Fruit trees in containers  
Rooftop gardening
Bees 
Aquaponics

• Energy:
Microsolar
Energy Efficiency - LED lights, weatherization, etc.

• Water:
Raingardens
Rain catchment 
Greywater 
Simple Compost toilet

During the workshop, the morning will be filled with practical knowledge and discussion. During the afternoon, after lunch, Lonnie will give us the inside scoop of a community garden project in our own downtown NYC Battery Park, a 5-minute walk from the downtown TM center. After walking to the park, we'll eat lunch, midday, here: http://www.thebattery.org/things-to-do/food. The admission price of the workshop is $30.  (Price of lunch is not included in the workshop fee.)  If you are interested in this workshop on Saturday, please register by clicking the registration link below. Please call Rita if you have any questions (ph:[masked]). 

Register for this Workshop -->

Sustainability is rooted in an understanding of the unity or connectedness that underlies the surface diversity of the universe. You will hear Professor Lonnie Gamble looking at practical ways in which sustainability may affect your life: housing, urban design, provision of energy and water, agriculture and food systems. He’ll explore the theory of deep sustainability and look at concrete examples from NYC and around the world, and he'll discuss the role that transcending can play in developing sustainability. 

About Workshop Leader

Lonnie Gamble is the director of the Sustainable Living Department at Maharishi University of Management in Fairfield, Iowa. His academic interests include renewable energy, integrated sustainable design, high performance building and sustainable economics. He has spoken in his area of interest at universities worldwide in places like Mongolia, Bhutan, Taiwan and Hawaii as well as dozens of US colleges and Universities. He recently completed the first course on Sustainable Living for the Great Courses Company. He is host of a radio show called Abundant Planet.  

His other projects include the design and development of Abundance Ecovillage, and a wide variety of consulting projects on sustainable energy, building, and education around the world. He lives with his wife and son in a straw bale house, powered by solar and wind and provisioned with rainwater and food from their extensive gardens and greenhouse. He hasn’t paid an electric bill in over 20 years. 

Register for this Workshop -->

We are looking forward to seeing you at the special event!
results.name: Special 1-day Workshop - Transcending & Practical Skills for Sustainable Living
